commit_message:
Replace direct type comparison with isinstance comparison.

This is more pythonic, because isinstance compares not only against
given type, but also again all its descendants.

Change-Id: I018ac057980ab2401d3916ac487566995ac877e0

commit_message:
LBaaS: update status of members according to health statistics

Added members health stats reporting to the haproxy driver.
During pool stats update db plugin checks for members stats
and updates members statuses if any

Fixes bug 1160125

Change-Id: I77bf13615607fcf91bf877c228811ea8008b2457

commit_message:
Added upper version boundry for six

The 1.4.0 version of six is not compatible with WSME 0.5b2.

This fixed bug #1219694.

Change-Id: Ifecf321865c98990b049d5df5de23eb1c90fd6c4
(cherry picked from commit 4e3351bc250a0b6278d71c4e6b88a147a9c762f5)

commit_message:
Use the name for this attribute that exists on Python3

It also exists going back to 2.6.

Change-Id: I8a1e285fa8091acf64bf5f9564d1a79882f9b3fb

subject: Change RPC to use new BDM format for instance boot

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 16:23:27.000000000', 'message': "Change RPC to use new BDM format for instance boot

This patch makes rpc calls that are the result of booting an instance
propagate the new block device mapping format.

The way this is done is by adding a 'legacy_bdm' flag to the conductor
(task) API. Since both the scheduler and the compute service propagate
the block device mapping as part of the request_spec field, a flag named
legacy_bdm_in_spec to indicate that was introduced in their respective
APIs.

Currently block_device_mapping is not used by any of the in-tree filters
in the scheduler, so it is assumed that scheduler's boot functionality
has now transitioned to the new format.

This patch also bumps RPC versions of the task, scheduler and compute
manager classes.

Finally this patch propagates the legacy_bdm_in_spec through the
run_instance callback of the compute manager so that, in case of error -
the instance is re-scheduled with the proper flag set.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5f25ddd4d586dda91061f065c1796be726b0ede3

legacy_bdm_in_spec to indicate that was introduced in their respective
APIs.

Currently block_device_mapping is not used by any of the in-tree filters
in the scheduler, so it is assumed that scheduler's boot functionality
has now transitioned to the new format.

This patch also bumps RPC versions of the task, scheduler and compute
manager classes.

Finally this patch propagates the legacy_bdm_in_spec through the
run_instance callback of the compute manager so that, in case of error -
the instance is re-scheduled with the proper flag set.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5f25ddd4d586dda91061f065c1796be726b0ede3

commit_message:
Change RPC to use new BDM format for instance boot

This patch makes rpc calls that are the result of booting an instance
propagate the new block device mapping format.

The way this is done is by adding a 'legacy_bdm' flag to the conductor
(task) API. Since both the scheduler and the compute service propagate
the block device mapping as part of the request_spec field, a flag named
legacy_bdm_in_spec to indicate that was introduced in their respective
APIs.

Currently block_device_mapping is not used by any of the in-tree filters
in the scheduler, so it is assumed that scheduler's boot functionality
has now transitioned to the new format.

This patch also bumps RPC versions of the task, scheduler and compute
manager classes.

Finally this patch propagates the legacy_bdm_in_spec through the
run_instance callback of the compute manager so that, in case of error -
the instance is re-scheduled with the proper flag set.

blueprint: improve-block-device-handling

Change-Id: I5f25ddd4d586dda91061f065c1796be726b0ede3

commit_message:
Add hive workflow creator

 * Added hive job type to job manager
 * Tests for hive workflow and job manager in case hive
 * Hive workflow creator
 * Upload hive-site.xml from /etc/hadoop/ to HDFS workflow dir

Change-Id: I97665a842cb07ee0fbf49cee39b7e84513026512

commit_message:
Add Fibre Channel drivers for Huawei storage systems

This is the third patch, changes as follows:
1.Add Fibre Channel drivers for huawei OceanStor T series and Dorado
series arrays. Dorado FC driver inherits codes from FC driver of T.
The FC drivers call module ssh_common which has been defined in
the preview patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41721/
2.Add unit test for the changes.

Implements: blueprint huawei-fibre-channel-volume-driver
Change-Id: Iee20d9746004b57777a7161827b4a23cb10f0859

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 07:21:12.000000000', 'message': 'Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69     """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1216820
Change-Id: Id9815033c0cb0e1aa6693a4c14bf9a5d490c8883
'}]
commit_message:
Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69     """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1216820
Change-Id: Id9815033c0cb0e1aa6693a4c14bf9a5d490c8883

commit_message:
Plug alarm history logic into the API

The alarm scenario tests provide forward-looking coverage
which will be run as the storage backends' support for alarm
history lands.

A new config option alarm.record_history (defaulting to True)
guards the recording of alarm history.

Partially implements bp alarm-audit-api

Change-Id: I0c3bc348c86c7dc645cde3029a6fa76f9f767c37

Hi Akihiro,

yes, it seems logical to me to use "# noqa" only for django imports and for some others if we have difficulties with replacing them with method imports (some "horizon/horizon" imports). I removed all "# noqa" I found after H302 merge and a few new ones. (I mean urls.py and views.py from this patch set: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/41775/ )

I think that we should be more careful with unnecessary "# noqa" in open reviews. Otherwise we'll have to keep cleaning this mess forever.'}]

This patch set replaces a few method imports with
module imports instead of "# noqa" comments.

Fixes bug 1219676

Change-Id: I4d99ec5cda556669737c1eae2f528fbd35590d60

commit_message:
"# noqa" cleanup

This patch set replaces a few method imports with
module imports instead of "# noqa" comments.

Change-Id: Iba27cb2f9bc1c017443e0666aa274b5f88373045
'}]
commit_message:
Start refactoring dynamic UI.

1. When using $value for form field attribute, first try
cleaned_data. And only if it is absent, use raw data.

2. Move all service fields classes into separate module fields.py

3. Move some helpers to helpers.py and rename __common.py to forms.py.

Change-Id: Iba27cb2f9bc1c017443e0666aa274b5f88373045

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-02 14:09:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't use a query for stack_get()

When getting a database record by ID, it is much more efficient to get() it
directly than to perform a query or the database to obtain the ID (again)
and then get it.

Since stack_get() returns only a single record that can be trivially
checked for deletion in code, do this rather than performing a query with a
filter.

Change-Id: I4bb3ea1a9c4ae928fe0f5bce5c02b842a3f1ab4f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use a query for stack_get()

When getting a database record by ID, it is much more efficient to get() it
directly than to perform a query or the database to obtain the ID (again)
and then get it.

Since stack_get() returns only a single record that can be trivially
checked for deletion in code, do this rather than performing a query with a
filter.

Change-Id: I4bb3ea1a9c4ae928fe0f5bce5c02b842a3f1ab4f

This was an oversight because os-collect-config was being pulled in most
of the time with os-apply-config. However, any element that uses o-a-c

commit_message:
Add os-apply-config to os-collect-config deps

This was an oversight because os-collect-config was being pulled in most
of the time with os-apply-config. However, any element that uses o-a-c
templates should definitely directly depend on o-a-c.

Change-Id: I713635376aaeb49bab1d6c1811d1404d7181e8b7

commit_message:
resync heat.conf.sample

The heat.conf.sample needs a resync, we had a broken duplicate script
for generating it, which did not pick up all config changes so we've
ended up out of sync with the code.

Change-Id: I076051ddd44847a1d8ae2340ab165e6cd744f595

commit_message:
Fixes unicode error issue

Glance api can't start due to the unicode issue. This fix
will make sure the string can be transformed as unicode.

Fixes bug 1218903

Change-Id: Id7a75ef4608d2a6a67ed2bd33e7d5c5854154bf5

commit_message:
Refactor huawei Dorado array iSCSI driver

This is the second patch, changes as follows:
1.Add ISCSIDriver for Dorado arrays. The ISCSIDriver inherit from T.
1.Add a common class DoradoCommon for both FC and iSCSI drivers. The common class
inherit from T common for they have many common functions.
2.Add unit test for Dorado drivers.

Change-Id: I7ff2cc1e0d058b7a3d9e55644769ec74075f962f

The latest patch set uses the correct template, but doesn't seem to address the other issues mentioned in https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1194506/comments/1"}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2013-08-23 06:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We are planning to implement the usages issue in Cinder (refer https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/add-volume-usages-to-limits), so horizon does not have to calculate this information, hence I have removed those changes from this patch.

Currently, without this fix users are not able to create snapshots from horizon.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-08-23 11:32:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would agree with Nuno here. The linked blueprint isn't implemented yet, and Nuno's patch was most of way toward having a workaround ready, while we wait for the better way to land. The UI doesn't look great without it."}, {'account_id': 4120, 'date': '2013-08-23 12:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The bug filed is specific to creating snapshots, which currently cannot be done via Horizon.
IMO, even if we implement the changes from the other patch(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36528/), the usage data displayed would be incorrect and misleading, since Horizon cannot take into account the "no_snapshot_gb_quota" flag in Cinder before calculating the "Total Gigabytes" value, which the blueprint addresses.'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-08-23 12:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I agree this is not ideal. However without it the form shows "{} GB" instead which is also confusing, and people will file bugs about it. IMO it's better to be consistent, and fix both charts as part of bug 1211741.'}, {'account_id': 6124, 'date': '2013-08-26 09:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-03 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-03 06:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Fixes snapshot create in horizon

* _quota.html has been removed in commit d4b0ab4aa395bf4df2964efcc358100117efdaa0
* Use correct template _limits.html

Fixes LP bug 1194506

Change-Id: Id5212518963e530de4cc23feee067b2dcdf6ed24

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-05-10 21:29:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

Hey,

First of all, thanks for the patch.

TBH, I don't like the idea of catching the error and moving on when it comes to policies. There are a couple of things that worry me here:

1) glance-api would keep working with the default policies
2) The user might not notice the error and this could be a security hole.

I'd rather catch the exception and exit(?) gracefully. At least, we should find a way to make sure the user knows what just happened. 

I'd like to know what other folks and yourself think about this. 

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 7219, 'date': '2013-05-16 13:00:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hard-coded defaults imply to me that they are something to fall back on.

Currently if there is no policy.json file when glance is started it will fall back on the default rules, this creates the same security issue e.g. if the file is incorrectly named.

Why do the defaults defined in the code exist?

To be sure that the user is always aware of the policy they are using would it be better to remove the defaults and require that a file specifying the policy always exists?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-05-20 14:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

A question inline ...

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-04 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-04 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-07 13:39:57.000000000', 'message': 'Handles exceptions when policy file cannot be read

Failures when reading/processing the policy file /etc/glance/policy.json
are handled so that default or cached rules are used.

An error message is logged if the file data is not JSON formatted.

An error message is logged whenever an exception is raised by
_read_policy_file.

Change-Id: If210b5755d8f9eac4eecaaf3869e003eac833b39
Fixes: bug #1177365
'}, {'created': '2013-07-25 07:22:06.000000000', 'message': 'Handles exceptions when policy file cannot be read

commit_message:
Handles exceptions when policy file cannot be read

Logs exceptions raised by _read_policy_file and raises an error

Change-Id: If210b5755d8f9eac4eecaaf3869e003eac833b39
Fixes: bug #1177365

You say this is inspired by the debug agent, and I can clearly see why!

Does it use the debug-agent, or is this an alternative to the debug agent?
The reason I am asking this is that if we have two components with largely overlapping functionalities, it probably won't make sense to maintain two of them.

Please note that there are several tabs and whitespaces to remove in the README file."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi. Okay those code should live under the debug directory and should be integrated to debug agent somehow.

Nati, Nova vif driver is used. Anyway the goal is to exercise plugin code without creating guest instance. So vif driver is out of scope.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress

v2 of this BP'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

Hi Yamahata-san

I agree with Salvatore. 
- some commands looks like overwrapping

  new function: RPC support, migration support ( I think this is cool feature)



As you mentioned in the commit  message, could you integrate debug-agent ?
One issue if found is plug and unplug uses fakevm code. It looks not using VIF driver in quantum or nova. So it looks not testing actual code'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

This is way too big a change.  It needs to be broken down into incremental pieces that reviewers have a chance of understanding and providing useful feedback on.'}, {'account_id': 4726, 'date': '2013-07-25 03:44:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Maru,

Which change did you point out? Since patch set 4?
It was long time during patch set 4 from 3, so there was a change that breaks fakevm in nova and quantum/neutron.
Therefore, some changes were necessary to let fakevm work.
In addition, I added core plugin supports and unit tests.

I intend to post a minimal change from patch set 3. It will be use of oslo.config and support for neutron mainly.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-25 11:23:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I agree with Maru. This patch should be split into sub part.
For example, the basic framework for fakevm (without plugin related code) and plugin related patch. The plugin related patch may be better to split into two parts: OVS and others.
We can set dependencies among patches.

Regarding the directory structure, it is better plugin related codes are placed into "plugins" subdirectory similar to the main codes.

fakevm config file has nova_conf section. The goal of this blueprint is tests without nova. Requiring nova.conf looks strange. If nova.conf is required, we must clarify which options are referred to.

It may be useful the contents of README is uploaded to Wiki. Wiki provides better rendering and it is easier to read.'}, {'account_id': 4726, 'date': '2013-07-26 05:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Akihiro,

Thank you for concrete explanation.
I understand what is needed for the separation of this patch.

I also agree to your suggestion about directory structure and nova.conf.

Is there wiki where I can add a page? Do you say about an outside public site such as github?'}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-28 01:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I would suggest adding information to a page linked to the Neutron wiki page here:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Neutron'}, {'account_id': 4726, 'date': '2013-07-29 07:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks Kyle.
I created my id on the wiki site, so I would be able to add a new page.'}, {'account_id': 4726, 'date': '2013-07-30 10:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 10:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

blueprint integrated-test-without-nova
This is a framework for plugin-integrated test without nova.

- fakevm-agent that replace nova-compute

- integrate this to debug-agent?

- add openvswitch and linuxbridge support
- add unit test
- rebase
- separate vif wrapper into a process in order to avoid the conflict of
  the configuration parameter of Nova and Quantum
- update document

commit_message:
fakevm: framework for neutron test without nova

blueprint integrated-test-without-nova
This is a framework for plugin-integrated test without nova.
Inspired by debug-agent

- fakevm-agent that replace nova-compute
- fakevm command to request plug/unplug on each fakevm-agent
- emulate multiple compute-node on single host
- emulate live-migration

TODO:
- live-migrate on single host
  It would need modification to nova vif driver
- devstack
- tempest
- enhance quantum test
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/quantum-basic-api
  https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/quantum-extended-api
- integrate this to debug-agent?

Changes 6 -> 7:
- separated plugins to an other patch set
- moved contents of README in wiki

Change-Id: If309e67d65b86f08538337274ca6476cc0ad5999

Current get_by_host_and_node() and get_by_host_and_not_type() accept
expected_attrs but does not passing into the DB layer. Thus if caller
passing expected_attrs and try to access the attributes, it will cause
lazy loading for each instance object.

Change the DB layer and passing the columns_to_join parameter.

Also change _manual_join_columns in DB to avoid code duplication.

Change-Id: I9a8b569908de7fcee31fb82f82078db4df04fa53
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Reduce lazy loading for 2 APIs in instance object

Current get_by_host_and_node() and get_by_host_and_not_type() accept
expected_attrs but does not passing into the DB layer. Thus if caller
passing expected_attrs and try to access the attributes, it will cause
lazy loading for each instance object.

Change the DB layer and passing the columns_to_join parameter.

Also change _manual_join_columns in DB to avoid code duplication.

Change-Id: I9a8b569908de7fcee31fb82f82078db4df04fa53
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-26 08:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Increased RAM and storage default values for nodes in devtest.md

On Fedora 19 (F19 64bit was used for seed, undercloud and overcloud)
I noticed HW limitations when running undercloud VM:
1) not enough memory: with 1024 RAM mysql server failed to start
   inside undercloud VM because of lack of free memory

2) undercloud failed to start overcloud VMs: when starting VMs,
   Nova service copies disk images from Glance internally and I ran
   out of disk space. Undercloud system was using 5G before I started
   overcloud, the rest of free space (another ~5G) was not enough for
   overcloud images.

Fixes bug: #1216814

Change-Id: I206989c480cb75aa098edfadd0612dbbc7232686
'}]
commit_message:
Increased RAM and storage default values for nodes in devtest.md

On Fedora 19 (F19 64bit was used for seed, undercloud and overcloud)
I noticed HW limitations when running undercloud VM:
1) not enough memory: with 1024 RAM mysql server failed to start
   inside undercloud VM because of lack of free memory

2) undercloud failed to start overcloud VMs: when starting VMs,
   Nova service copies disk images from Glance internally and I ran
   out of disk space. Undercloud system was using 5G before I started
   overcloud, the rest of free space (another ~5G) was not enough for
   overcloud images.

Fixes bug: #1216814

Change-Id: I206989c480cb75aa098edfadd0612dbbc7232686

[{'created': '2013-08-21 00:07:32.000000000', 'message': 'Narrowed version support of hp3parclient

Modified test-requires to not pull in
hp3parclient greater that 2.0. for
Grizzly only.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Narrowed version support of hp3parclient

Modified test-requires to not pull in
hp3parclient greater that 2.0. for
Grizzly only.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie07629b9bd11ec19262c8398d712ad1a34b02d93
Fixes: bug #1214635

commit_message:
Add client support for blueprint live-snapshot-vms

Based on the blueprint for live snapshots [1] and depends on
the new live image API [2]. This adds client-side support for
the extended API. This is pretty straight-forward, and precisely
mirrors the standard image commands.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-snapshot-vms
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/34036/

Change-Id: I61403a4954f296443df9f7e9b10ebe0067651ddf
Signed-off-by: Adin Scannell <adin@scannell.ca>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-23 23:31:00.000000000', 'message': 'Standardize exception usage in brick.lvm

The brick exceptions tend to make an incorrect
assumption that the exceptions from the executor
will be of class processutils.ProcessExecutionError.

This may or may not be true because we pass in an
executor which is most likely going to be the wrapped
putils executor from cinder/utils.py.  The result here
is that we almost never actually catch exceptions.

This change fixes that by making a generic except, and
then takes that exception and extracts things like
stdout, stderr and the attempted cmd and builds a
brick exception of type LVMCommandExecutionFailure
w/ the above mentioned attributes when possible.

This only fixes the issue in the LVM module!

The other modules in brick will need addressed,
in addition, this points out that the calling driver
has never been catching these exceptions.  They
were typically handled by the manager, but now we need
to do some work to clean things up in task flows.

Partially fixes bug 1216051

Change-Id: Ic5ff9b01fc5393c7891fc9092a7d9022aa91a6a5
'}]
commit_message:
Standardize exception usage in brick.lvm

The brick exceptions tend to make an incorrect
assumption that the exceptions from the executor
will be of class processutils.ProcessExecutionError.

This may or may not be true because we pass in an
executor which is most likely going to be the wrapped
putils executor from cinder/utils.py.  The result here
is that we almost never actually catch exceptions.

This change fixes that by making a generic except, and
then takes that exception and extracts things like
stdout, stderr and the attempted cmd and builds a
brick exception of type LVMCommandExecutionFailure
w/ the above mentioned attributes when possible.

This only fixes the issue in the LVM module!

The other modules in brick will need addressed,
in addition, this points out that the calling driver
has never been catching these exceptions.  They
were typically handled by the manager, but now we need
to do some work to clean things up in task flows.

Partially fixes bug 1216051

Change-Id: Ic5ff9b01fc5393c7891fc9092a7d9022aa91a6a5

I think you need to have a good look at the diff first. There seem to be quite a few changes unrelated to the bug you are trying to fix. Especially in the v3 version of servers.py. The min/max count stuff has now been abstracted away to an extension multiple_create and should not be put back in.

commit_message:
Exception is thrown if multiple instances are launched with the port id(s)

Fixed Bug 1191069.

Change-Id: Ie89923187daad98b42edd6b5d019633cb0ad2544

"}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-08-09 13:47:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I'm sorry, but I don't understand this refactoring.  1370 lines of SSH functions, but wait, you have create_volume, delete_volume, and other assorted functions that have nothing to do with SSH.  I would have one main Huawei class that inherits from VolumeDriver with configuration and SSH code.  From there, 3 subclasses, one for each of T, Dorado, and HVS.  And under each of those subclasses for iSCSI and FC."}, {'account_id': 6604, 'date': '2013-08-12 02:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi,Avishay
Thanks for your attention first.I answer from two aspects:
1.The file ssh_common.py defines two common classes for T and Dorado. Each common class has many functions which are needed
for both FC and iSCSI drivers. For T and Dorado, these functions run CLI through SSH methods, and for HVS, they use
REST. We add the prefix "ssh_" and "hvs_" to distinguish between the two.  2.As for the driver structure? we provide a unified class HuaweiVolumeDriver for users. This class will call subclasses T, Dorado or HVS according to users' configuration. And under each of these subclass for iSCSI and FC. We make the subclass iSCSI and FC inherited from the base classes driver.ISCSIDriver and driver.FCDriver respectively.'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-08-12 09:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Why are all of these common functions implemented in ssh_common?  There should be a subclasses of VolumeDriver which implement those with proper inheritance.'}, {'account_id': 6604, 'date': '2013-08-13 02:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Functions in ssh_common are all subfunctions which are called by my ISCSIDriver or FCDriver. And those two classes are inherited from base class driver.ISCSIDriver or driver.FCdriver. So my classes are subclasses of VolumeDriver in fact. They could inherit functions copy_image_volume and copy_volume_to_image from father class. This is similar with HP 3PAR drivers.'}, {'account_id': 6604, 'date': '2013-08-13 16:09:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-13 16:44:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'created': '2013-08-13 16:09:14.000000000', 'message': "Refactor huawei iSCSI driver

We plan to refactor Huawei drivers and add FC drivers. For that's a huge change,
we break the codes into three patches:
1.Refactor T iSCSI driver
2.Refactor Dorado iSCSI driver
3.Add FC drivers for both T and Dorado arrays.

This is the first patch, changes as follows:
1.Define a common class for both FC and iSCSI drivers, and also provide a unified class
HuaweiVolumeDriver for users. The unified driver will call ISCSIDriver according to users'
configuration. The ISCSIDriver is a subclass of driver.ISCSIDriver, so it could get good
inheritance.
2.Support volume type.
3.Refactor unit test to make it more logic clear and add more test cases to get higher
coverage rate.

Change-Id: I79b7bac7f38f2dcbb22c5db6207d8b55906fdad1

commit_message:
Refactor Huawei iSCSI driver

We plan to refactor Huawei iSCSI drivers and add Huawei FC
drivers. For that's a huge change, we break the codes into
three patches:
1.Refactor T iSCSI driver
2.Refactor Dorado iSCSI driver
3.Add FC drivers for both T and Dorado arrays.

This is the first patch, changes as follows:
1.Define a common class for both FC and iSCSI drivers, and
also provide a unified class HuaweiVolumeDriver for users.
The unified driver will call HuaweiTISCSIDriver according to
users' configuration. The HuaweiTISCSIDriver is a subclass of
driver.ISCSIDriver, so it could get good inheritance.
2.Support volume type.
3.Refactor unit test to make it more logic clear and add more
test cases to get higher coverage rate.

Change-Id: I79b7bac7f38f2dcbb22c5db6207d8b55906fdad1

commit_message:
bp:restructure-documentation Restructure of Configuration Reference

Initial re-structure of guide (more is definitely needed, including
 edits, but can now work per component). Ensured all sections are
 consolidated under one of the services. Minor edits to work with
 structure flow. Redid guide intro to list all components. Added
 subdirectories for networking and compute (to match existing
 for block-storage and object-storage).

Change-Id: I7cf3ddbb48c201ac89b037daff786dfb7a22dd34

commit_message:
Use the horizon_pagesize value in the session cookie

This makes the API calls that are claiming to do pagination work
the same as Nova, which has had it the longest.  Namely, there's a
user setting to control how many rows get returned.  Make them heed
it.

Fixes Bug: 1217608
Change-Id: I19b4d7c77d595b898abb81462f6343bbc1b93eb6

'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-04-24 08:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Ray,

Thanks for working on this!

Unfortunately I think proper Nova support is a blocker on this. At the moment when I set a flavor to private it seems to work but the flavor disappears from the dashboard. The only way I can edit it after this is to add myself to a project that has explicit access to the flavor. This isn't a great user-experience.

But... I did some digging and it turns out the support is only missing from novaclient. I've submitted a patch here: https://review.openstack.org/27403

Once that is merged and we have a new version on pypi, we can approve this change."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-04-24 08:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just a couple of initial comments on the code:

1) There's a lot of copied code in horizon.flavors.js, which isn't great for maintenance.

You should be able to use the existing horizon.projects.js or adapt it to work with the flavor access panel. See 
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows.py:UpdateInstanceSecurityGroups for an example of how to do that (using the UpdateMembersStep class).

There is also a shared template at horizon/templates/horizon/common/_workflow_step_update_members.html. You can modify that to support the visible form fields.

Unfortunately the naming of this code still hasn't been updated so the javascript might be a little confusing. That's something I need to fix. If you need any help with this, let me know.

2) I think the name of the workflow step should still be "Flavor Access" since that's what it's about.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-05-02 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A couple issues:

  1. Shouldn't a project member be able to manage flavors for their own project? The admin functionality here is good, but it needs a counterpart in the project dashboard.

  2. When you mark a flavor as private (e.g. uncheck "public") the flavor no longer appears in the admin flavor list unless your admin project is assigned to it. This needs to be corrected so that admins see *all* flavors regardless of what project they're in.

  3. The UI with the "public" checkbox enabling/disabling the ability to add/remove projects below is confusing. Adding some help text indicating that you need to uncheck "public" first would be the easy route. Alternatively you could always allow editing and automatically uncheck public if they specify only specific projects should have access to the flavor.

This is really coming along, though, and it definitely does work in terms of core functionality. Keep up the hard work, it's almost there!'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-05-28 04:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For point 2, my change got merged, so in the admin case you can call nova.flavors.list() with is_public=None and it will return all flavors.

See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27403/2/novaclient/v1_1/flavors.py'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-06-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Define flavor for each project

Change CreateFlavor/EditFlavor forms to CreateFlavor/UpdateFlavor
workflows. Provide access flavor management in each project. Add
the filtering function in Flavors page.

Implements blueprint define-flavor-for-project

Change-Id: I723bbf250a46af8de58de06a907f6efc737778db

"}, {'account_id': 8291, 'date': '2013-08-13 19:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 5319, 'date': '2013-08-14 08:33:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What I suggested is to add a new option to instance details which is called Storage Backend, this is different from booting from existing volume.

My proposal: Add a new attribute: Backend, which can either be Local Disk File(Default like before) or Volume.

What happens when somebody chooses Volume as instance Storage backend?
1. We create a new Volume with the size of root gb of the flavor, this volume is created from the image chosen
2. If there is an ephemeral disk in the flavor we create another Volume based on the flavor epeheral gb disk size and attach it to vdb
3. We launch the instance with the two attached volumes, the volume created in step 1 should be used as root and contains the image that the user choose.

Not sure if all if this is supported now though.

The current patch uses Volume Options to change this. Let me see how we can implement this nicely. Current approach is also possible it would achieve the same result in the end, but less intuitive for end-users. I prefer to re-use flavors and user doesn't have to care if the storage of the flavor is on a local disk or on a volume. Should be created in the same way, same workflow, same user experience."}, {'account_id': 8291, 'date': '2013-08-14 16:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8291, 'date': '2013-08-14 16:17:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Sam,
Really, I just implemented only boot from image with creating a volume by using a new Nova functionality 'clone image'.

You have a nice plan to modify web-interface, but we need to review and be sure that all these new functionality in the Nova are tested and works well.

I'm not sure about implementation of this blueprint in full before code-freeze for Havana-3, which will be happen soon."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-14 17:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

I've just run this code and confirmed the current implementation to determine the size is not right.

Take for example an ubuntu image with size of 260mb then it will create an volume with a size of 260mb, this way the user can't do anything with the created because there is no space left at all.

Another issue I noticed is that if you Select an image in instance details and also select an image with the Boot from Image option you will get an error: You can't select an instance source when booting from a Volume. The Volume is your source and should contain the operating system. This error may be fine though, as working around this may be pretty hard."}, {'account_id': 8291, 'date': '2013-08-23 12:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7808, 'date': '2013-08-23 12:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 7808, 'date': '2013-08-23 12:55:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The main problem I see is assuming we have the new and unreleased version of novaclient available which doesn't have to be the case as clients follow a different release schedule than core projects. In that case it should notify or hide the option. Other than that, it look great to me."}, {'account_id': 8291, 'date': '2013-08-23 14:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 8291, 'date': '2013-08-23 14:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

We made restructurization. We removed tab "Volumes" from launch instance
pop-up. And all contains at the "Volumes" was moved to first tab
"Details". The field "Instance Boot Source" contains following options:
- Boot from image.
- Boot from snapshot.
- Boot from volume.
- Boot from image (creates a new volume).
- Boot from volume snapshot (creates a new volume).
For option "Boot from image (creates a new volume)" we
added new field "Device size (Gb)", to determine size of volume. It's
required parameter for Nova.

Into according to these changes, situation of selection image and volume
together will be imposible.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-23 16:19:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'created': '2013-08-28 13:53:39.000000000', 'message': 'Improved boot from volume

In connection to blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/improve-block-device-handling
and extension of nova boot functionality (Image Clone), we propose optimaze
web-interface of launche VM instances and reflect new Nova functionalities.

Tab "Volumes" was moved to "Details" and called as "Instance Boot Source"
section in the "Launche instance" pop-up window.
The field "Instance Boot Source" contains following options:
- Boot from image.
- Boot from snapshot.
- Boot from volume.
- Boot from image (creates a new volume).
- Boot from volume snapshot (creates a new volume).

For option "Boot from image (creates a new volume)" we added new field
"Device size (GB)", to determine size of volume. It's required for Nova.

Implements: blueprint improved-boot-from-volume

Change-Id: I92ee5704d70c32b2c73c60c4d424d7d6d320ab24

commit_message:
Improved boot from volume

In connection to blueprint:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/improve-block-device-handling
and extension of nova boot functionality (Image Clone), we propose optimaze
web-interface of launche VM instances and reflect new Nova functionalities.

Tab "Volumes" was moved to "Details" and called as "Instance Boot Source"
section in the "Launche instance" pop-up window.
The field "Instance Boot Source" contains following options:
- Boot from image.
- Boot from snapshot.
- Boot from volume.
- Boot from image (creates a new volume).
- Boot from volume snapshot (creates a new volume).

For option "Boot from image (creates a new volume)" we added new field
"Device size (GB)", to determine size of volume. It's required for Nova.

Implements: blueprint improved-boot-from-volume

Change-Id: I92ee5704d70c32b2c73c60c4d424d7d6d320ab24

commit_message:
The "arg_value" was not getting checked for empty list

In the _merge_args function it is possible that "arg_value" which is
an instance of a list can be an empty list. We still want to append
"value" which is also an instance of list (passed as part of "_extra_values"
argument) to it. arg_value was not getting checked for empty list.

Fixes bug #1108365

Change-Id: Ief028a3fd1cacefcf1beab408e1117f3e0dd588f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-02 16:05:19.000000000', 'message': 'Setup loghandlers in o-c-c binary

On a system with o-c-c installed by pip the binary generated by PBR
calls __main__() directly, the code that sets up logging sould be placed
here otherwise it will be bypassed. Resulting in missing log messages.

Change-Id: I94ba4f61be9595a6ddee134d806e5f99ae4adf73
'}]
commit_message:
Setup loghandlers in o-c-c binary

On a system with o-c-c installed by pip the binary generated by PBR
calls __main__() directly, the code that sets up logging sould be placed
here otherwise it will be bypassed. Resulting in missing log messages.

Change-Id: I94ba4f61be9595a6ddee134d806e5f99ae4adf73

commit_message:
Configure default virsh network

On Ubuntu and Debian, the default virsh network is not configured
to start after installation or to autostart when the system is
booted.

The default network is needed by the seed vm to boot.

Change-Id: I29f07af0f6b355bb3dc3fbf028d088b7736cb1e3

commit_message:
Add metering panel to admin console

Now it has usage tables for disk usage,
network traffic usage, network(neutron) usage,
objectstore usage, all agregates of project.

A multiseries linechart with choosable meters, group by, value and time
span.

Reasonable amount of tests implemented over all resource usage tabs.

Change-Id: I21342d595ee08da45707e909f3d9802707d912cc
Implements: blueprint admin-resource-usage-page

commit_message:
Adding panels for trove

* Add python-troveclient to requirements.
* Add trove api to openstack_dashboard apis.
* Add Database Instances panel.
* Add Database Backups panel.

Authors:
* Robert Myers
* Denis Makogon
* Andrea Giardini

Implements: Blueprint trove-support

Change-Id: I0541534612ccb491d692168c3c9ca7a841650be6

Salvatore, as you pointed it out, it's the second time I faced this kind of issue (probably just because I'm currently playing around ml2), I'll risk a comment (don't know if it's feasible):

Wouldn't it be possible to force extensions to come as two separate patches: a first one for extension & reference agent implementation, and the other one implementing the extension for (at least) reference plugin? This would force agent and extension to cross gating without assuming that the reference plugin supports this extension. As all plugins can't be gated, this could help to ensure that extension won't change default behaviour."}, {'account_id': 6522, 'date': '2013-09-02 22:52:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}]

With the introduction of extra_dhcp_opt extension, DHCP agent
stopped serving mac adresses when used in conjunction with a
plugin that doesn't support this extension. This fixes the agent
by not assuming that port dict contains extra_dhcp_opt key.

Closes Bug: #1219893

Change-Id: I5bb52f3092f04c5e332b43cb3a04de05edc29cf5

commit_message:
Fix DHCP agent to work without extra_dhcp_opt extension

With the introduction of extra_dhcp_opt extension, DHCP agent
stopped serving mac adresses when used in conjunction with a
plugin that doesn't support this extension. This fixes the agent
by not assuming that port dict contains extra_dhcp_opt key.

Closes Bug: #1219893

Change-Id: I5bb52f3092f04c5e332b43cb3a04de05edc29cf5

commit_message:
Make _test_update_resource honor format

Closes-Bug: #1217759

Partial-Bug: #1217791
Due to the Related-Bug: #1217791, MyComparator does not work
in some cases. We need to use a workaround that serialized body
to mocked self.client.httpclient.request. It is already adopted
in _test_create_resourse and I borrow it.

Change-Id: I746d272bc7ba8542c29e47823f707a761dddb0b1

commit_message:
Adds metrics collection support in Hyper-V

Blueprint: hyper-v-metrics

Hyper-V Server 2012 supports a new set of metrics API that can be used to
provide switch port metrics data to external applications, e.g. Ceilometer.

Metrics collection is disabled by default and can be enabled with a config
option.

Metrics are configured via ACLs applied by the Hyper-V plugin agent.

Change-Id: Ife2a53db84936bae7c73b8c027022bbc5e89d48a

commit_message:
Adds support for admin to create flavors through mgmt API

Extending the management API to allow for an admin to
create flavors categorized on service type in trove.

Change-Id: If8c92cf1982ad6023f1877c3c61ea4ffc28a5b1d
Implements: blueprint service-type-filter-on-flavors

commit_message:
Move vpn unittest code to neutronclient.tests

Closes-Bug: #1217205

This commit fixes the following bugs which are detected by moving
VPN unittests.

* Raise CommandError instead of Value/KeyError in VPN parameter
  validation (Closes-Bug: #1219192)

* Delete dpd_timeout_less_than_interval test in IPsec site
  connection tests.  CLI does not validate this and it raises
  ConnectionError and results in the test failure.
  (Previously this test catches a general Exception,
   so the unit test does not fail unexpectedly.)
  (Closes-Bug: #1219389)

  There is a confusion on whether dpd_timeout == dpd_interval
  should be accepted in server side code, document and CLI.
  it is important to make VPN related tests enabled, so I decided
  to leave the fix of validation logic in the future work.
  (Filed as Related-bug: #1219440)

Change-Id: Ie4f4e8cdf533a983d0a6d4d564a7267a3323b832

commit_message:
Add baremetal type to register-endpoint

This will allow developers to utilize the register-endpoint script
to manually add the ironic baremetal service to keystone.

Change-Id: Iccb49a9ff431d925c0b44de1eb687ebab4dd9bc0

commit_message:
Adds support for admin to create flavors through mgmt API

Extending the management API to allow for an admin to
create flavors categorized on service type in trove.

Implements: blueprint service-type-filter-on-flavors

Change-Id: I571a51122b70786b16284a0e1e297875bffa8ae8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 16:40:02.000000000', 'message': "baremetal: Increase default IPMI power on/off retries

The baremetal driver tries 5 times in 2.5 seconds to shut off the power
to a device under its control. However, it may take longer than 2.5
seconds to make the power state change on some older hardware, resulting
in an InstancePowerOffFailure exception being raised before the device
has powered down.  The exception triggers a bug in nova-compute that
prevents further power-state syncing: nova-compute never sees the
shutdown complete, and the instance becomes wedged executing the current
task (bug 1212420).

This patch attempts to work around the slow power-off issue by
increasing the default number of IPMI power state polling attempts from
5 to 20, thus increasing the shutdown grace period from 2.5 seconds to
10 seconds.  The changed setting is used in the IPMI driver's
_power_on and _power_off methods.

As a side effect this change also increases the power-on grace period by
the same amount.

Fixes: bug 1177584
Change-Id: I4aac90ecbbc0d7c708ce2f9d64cf5e5edeb877fa
"}, {'created': '2013-08-19 22:12:27.000000000', 'message': "baremetal: Increase default IPMI power on/off retries

The baremetal driver tries 5 times in 2.5 seconds to shut off the power
to a device under its control. However, it may take longer than 2.5
seconds to make the power state change on some older hardware, resulting
in an InstancePowerOffFailure exception being raised before the device
has powered down.  The exception triggers a bug in nova-compute that
prevents further power-state syncing: nova-compute never sees the
shutdown complete, and the instance becomes wedged executing the current
task (bug 1212420).

This patch attempts to work around the slow power-off issue by
increasing the default number of IPMI power state polling attempts from
5 to 20, thus increasing the shutdown grace period from 2.5 seconds to
10 seconds.  The changed setting is used in the IPMI driver's
_power_on and _power_off methods.

As a side effect this change also increases the power-on grace period by
the same amount.

Partial-Bug: #1177584
Change-Id: I4aac90ecbbc0d7c708ce2f9d64cf5e5edeb877fa
"}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Increase default IPMI power on/off retries

The baremetal driver tries 5 times in 2.5 seconds to shut off the power
to a device under its control. However, it may take longer than 2.5
seconds to make the power state change on some older hardware, resulting
in an InstancePowerOffFailure exception being raised before the device
has powered down.  The exception triggers a bug in nova-compute that
prevents further power-state syncing: nova-compute never sees the
shutdown complete, and the instance becomes wedged executing the current
task (bug 1212420).

This patch attempts to work around the slow power-off issue by
increasing the default number of IPMI power state polling attempts from
5 to 20, thus increasing the shutdown grace period from 2.5 seconds to
10 seconds.  The changed setting is used in the IPMI driver's
_power_on and _power_off methods.

As a side effect this change also increases the power-on grace period by
the same amount.

Partial-Bug: #1177584
Change-Id: I4aac90ecbbc0d7c708ce2f9d64cf5e5edeb877fa

[{'created': '2013-07-05 02:32:52.000000000', 'message': 'fix bug #1190606 Glanceclient doesn't properly handle malformed ids
when the image_id was passed in, it was expected as string
so basiclly, using "urllib.quote(image_id)" is no problem,
but when the image_id is passed in as int, like '132221',it will go
wrong:
'int' object has no attribute 'rstrip',

Change-Id: I784c5760e12d946112ba75744ecfb1f38e0d69c0
'}, {'created': '2013-07-05 04:21:58.000000000', 'message': 'fix the problem that Glanceclient doesn't properly handle malformed ids

when the image_id was passed in, it was expected as string so basiclly
using "urllib.quote(image_id)" is no problem
but when the image_id is passed in as int, like '132221'
it will go wrong:
'int' object has no attribute 'rstrip'

fix bug #1190606

Change-Id: I784c5760e12d946112ba75744ecfb1f38e0d69c0
'}]
commit_message:
fix the problem that Glanceclient doesn't properly handle malformed ids

when the image_id was passed in, it was expected as string so basiclly
using "urllib.quote(image_id)" is no problem
but when the image_id is passed in as int, like '132221'
it will go wrong:
'int' object has no attribute 'rstrip'

fix bug #1190606

Change-Id: I784c5760e12d946112ba75744ecfb1f38e0d69c0

imported modules.

instantiation because the service-catalog retrieval process overrides that
parameter.

This behaviour is overriding the endpoint_url parameter is unexpected given the

commit_message:
Makes client always use provided endpoint_url

When nova uses neutron-client and the client needs to authenticate with
keystone it will additionally retrieve the service-catalog. The client will
then ignore the provided endpoint_url parameter given to it during
instantiation because the service-catalog retrieval process overrides that
parameter.

Using the endpoint declared in the service-catalog even though the endpoint is
given is unexpected given the precedent set by glance-client to respect that
parameter. Ensuring the parameter is used will allow users to override the
identity's catalog. This is useful if identity is in error, or if the user is
using a special development configuration.

Unit tests are included to test that said functionality occurs.

Fixes: bug #1212812
Change-Id: Iad2eaf4096fd5278740c3664cc369853814ee2d5

commit_message:
Reader/writer no longer used

Remove the reader/writer lock as it is no
longer used and if it is needed I would
rather thing of other ways to do this as
getting the reader/writer lock usage incorrect
will mean deadlock.

Change-Id: I4518c25e65626dc5a77f4e899c258ff9da76fea1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-29 23:59:50.000000000', 'message': 'DRY up use of @wrap_exception() decorator

We pass the same args to this decorator everywhere, except we have a
different publisher ID for compute api versus compute manager. Use
functools.partial() to avoid this repitition.

Also, this decorator changes with the port to oslo.messaging and this
change reduces the number of places affected by that.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I54fee992a9995ad3085a6ccd1627958f6dd9ad60
'}]
commit_message:
DRY up use of @wrap_exception() decorator

We pass the same args to this decorator everywhere, except we have a
different publisher ID for compute api versus compute manager. Use
functools.partial() to avoid this repitition.

Also, this decorator changes with the port to oslo.messaging and this
change reduces the number of places affected by that.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I54fee992a9995ad3085a6ccd1627958f6dd9ad60

commit_message:
Add flag to make IsolatedHostsFilter less restrictive

This patch allows to run 'isolated' and 'non isolated'
images on isolated hosts by adding a flag
'restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images'.

If the flag is set to True then 'non isolated' images
can't be run on isolated hosts (same behaviour as the
current filter) otherwise they can be run on isolated
hosts.

DocImpact

blueprint improve-isolatedhostsfilter

Change-Id: I8c092caf32c05be88a547a7e8cb0530cc4925080

commit_message:
Added upper version boundry for six to <1.4.0

The 1.4.0 version of six is not compatible with WSME 0.5b2.

This fixed bug #1219694.

Change-Id: I3a0b2c726eba8fa851c1a22a52bf50076b608dbf

[{'created': '2013-08-29 09:31:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove unused fake run_instance() method

In a bunch of tests, we stub out rpc.call() and use it as a hook to
create instances and return their details.

The thing is, we never actually call() 'run_instance anymore .. we
always cast() it. So, these fake methods never actually get called and
can be safely removed.

A similar change was made in I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68
but some more copies of this have been added recently. Copy and pasted

commit_message:
Remove unused fake run_instance() method

In a bunch of tests, we stub out rpc.call() and use it as a hook to
create instances and return their details.

The thing is, we never actually call() 'run_instance anymore .. we
always cast() it. So, these fake methods never actually get called and
can be safely removed.

A similar change was made in I63bbc98c285faebec53f8e62857c01548807db68
but some more copies of this have been added recently. Copy and pasted
code FTW!

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I1a5a048ed9b0d939d50f7728a348bb6c5a6074dc

commit_message:
handle auto assigned flag on allocate floating ip

Set auto_assigned field to the right value on allocating floating ip to
avoid potential race condition in nova-network.

fix bug 1190585

Change-Id: I8ee34924439d2a29b1b5a966b92856e63cc1afdc

I'm a little bit torn. On the one hand, what russellb said - why this vs. libvirt. On the other hand, if this gets us a sensible answer for how to make openstack tools and apis a sensible way to do local container management, then that's potentially cool. (I say that because of the AUFS stuff in docker with images and the glance driver and whatnot)

I do think sorting out the overlap in duties (such as double ips) wouldn't be a terrible idea..."}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-06-17 23:01:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I'd really like to see some functional testing for this before it goes in.  If support for docker is added to devstack, we should be able to test this via the openstack jenkins pretty easily.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-July/011260.html"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-07-03 09:56:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In addition to what Russell suggested wrt devstack, this needs to come with good unit test coverage too."}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-07-04 00:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Daniel,

I agree with Russell's feedback about adding functional tests (via devstack + jenkins). However I'd like to know more about what you would see to be tested other than the unit tests already there.

Since I am using the "test_virt_drivers" test suite which calls each method of the driver (see the changeset), I don't see what else I can test even though Docker itself will be tested through the functional tests mentioned above.

I'd be glad to fix any mistake I could have done (I am pretty new to openstack).'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-07-04 08:55:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

The test_virt_drivers.py is fairly simple only testing one "normal" execution path for each public driver API. I've not looked closely, but there is usually scope for doing more specific testing of driver methods to coverage other codepaths that the test_virt_drivers.py wouldn't otherwise hit. For example, despite test_virt_drivers.py there is an enourmous  test_libvirt.py class to test more of the libvirt driver.py

Since you've configured the tests with run with MockClient, the HTTPClient code isn't getting any coverage. Thus there is scope for directly testing the operation of the HTTPClient class using a mock'd http server, and also test the helper methods in the util.py file.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-12 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-12 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Restored

Restoring the code review to include the following changes:

* Removed the dependency from Glance (it's now possible to use the user_data field to specify the docker's image name + command name)
* Addressed the FIXME about the timeout for waiting the cgroup to be created
* Froze the Docker API calls to 1.3 to avoid regressions

Also, adding Docker support to devstack is in progress."}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-08-06 00:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-06 01:11:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Added new hypervisor to support Docker containers

Docker brings an alternative to support Linux Containers (LXC)
as instances. The code has been imported from:
https://github.com/dotcloud/openstack-docker

blueprint new-hypervisor-docker

Change-Id: I0f1ff8acb5a93ba1dc680c68633c43454d1e804c

commit_message:
Add diskimage-creating script, elements for mirrors

* Automatic building Fedora and Ubuntu cloud images with all elements from savanna-extra repository
* Using mirrors for updating images

Change-Id: I12632b5cee42b1dbfd79b7b7c3a7b26962ace625

commit_message:
Neutron support

Added configurations:
* use_neutron

If Neutron is enabled, management network id is
passed as a parameter, when instances are being
launched.

Instance's internal and management IPs are equal and
point to the first IP in a list of a specified
management network.

Model classes for Cluster and Cluster Template updated.

Implements blueprint add-neutron-support

Conflicts:
	savanna/config.py
	savanna/db/sqlalchemy/models.py
	savanna/service/instances.py
	savanna/service/networks.py

Change-Id: Ia87e5372d007d88cab3cc2de3651e78eff3544aa

[{'created': '2013-09-02 07:57:24.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore error when removing hostkey

When removing a hostkey, the script boot-seed-vm dies if the key is
not present in the ~/.ssh/known_hosts file

Change-Id: Ia93837308631117bf9ad1b40882e8c5400d326a4
'}, {'created': '2013-09-02 12:44:07.000000000', 'message': "Ignore error when removing hostkey

When removing a hostkey, the script boot-seed-vm dies if the file
~/.ssh/known_hosts doesn't exists.

Change-Id: Ia93837308631117bf9ad1b40882e8c5400d326a4
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore error when removing hostkey

When removing a hostkey, the script boot-seed-vm dies if the file
~/.ssh/known_hosts doesn't exists.

Change-Id: Ia93837308631117bf9ad1b40882e8c5400d326a4

commit_message:
Introduces Openstack-Specific Report Utilities

Introduces classes representing various Openstack-specific
views, data models, and generators.  This commit also introduces
the folder for generators, since the only predefined generators are
those which are Openstack-specific.

Change-Id: Ice56cb63b2a9807b15642d7cfa4f24a507c70266
Implements: bp guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Introduces Report Views

Introduces classes representing generic view types for each of the
standard report serialization types: text (human-readable), JSON, and
XML.  Each category of view has at least a basic key-value view.
Additionally, a view which utilizes the Jinja templating system
(http://jinja.pocoo.org/) is available for easy creation of more
complex views.  Finally, a method of specifying several views for
a model, each associated with a different serialization type, was
introduced.

Change-Id: I30b127d67587127e5f08317fe06fa81246897ed6
Implements: bp guru-meditation-report

commit_message:
Remove references to the multiple config files

Only refer to heat.conf in the docs and scripts.
For install.sh copy the iniset() function from devstack
to assist in setting some semi-sane defaults.

Change-Id: I933891e35103c003f1272bc89c7b42d2ad76697b

commit_message:
Fix VMware fakes

The mock vmware objects in fake.py incorrectly represent the
corresponding vSphere server objects. This patch aims to fill
those gaps in the testing framework.

Fixes: bug #1200482
Change-Id: Idc1f93af466e1521c6df655d2851cd923507cc07

commit_message:
Port flavormanage extension to v3 API part 1

This is part 1 of the two part commit to port migrations to v3.
As part of this commit the api and test files are copied over to v3
plugins folder. The second changeset will have changes to port
migrations to v3.

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I2a51185f557c68022a2f3aaa006acb1e89b3c737

commit_message:
Fix FK violation in ConsoleTestCase

setUp() of ConsoleTestCase creates a few Console instances
that reference a non-existing instance with generated UUID
value. The tests work great on SQLite (because FKs are disabled),
but fail on MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I2417b6f6dad8c9c84af8b49a3c6db8b9bb715e56

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 23:11:40.000000000', 'message': 'EC2token middleware implement multi-cloud auth

Making ec2token middleware multi-cloud aware presents a
challenge as the API assumes there is only one cloud and
Heat must remain compatible. This means that unlike multi-cloud
heat-api, the request cannot explicitly say which endpoint it
wants to authenticate against.

However it must be possible to make authenticated cfn requests
against a multi-cloud heat for the sake of cfntools requests.

The approach taken in this commit is to attempt authentication
against each configured allowed_auth_uris until one succeeds.

This is safe for the following reasons:
1. AWSAccessKeyId is a randomly generated sequence
2. No secret is transferred to validate a request

If all auth attempts fail, the last failed reason is raised
as the error to the user.

Change-Id: I3a5a7adc97b110fcb8c6e8b156749fdec8924b88
'}]
commit_message:
EC2token middleware implement multi-cloud auth

Making ec2token middleware multi-cloud aware presents a
challenge as the API assumes there is only one cloud and
Heat must remain compatible. This means that unlike multi-cloud
heat-api, the request cannot explicitly say which endpoint it
wants to authenticate against.

However it must be possible to make authenticated cfn requests
against a multi-cloud heat for the sake of cfntools requests.

The approach taken in this commit is to attempt authentication
against each configured allowed_auth_uris until one succeeds.

This is safe for the following reasons:
1. AWSAccessKeyId is a randomly generated sequence
2. No secret is transferred to validate a request

If all auth attempts fail, the last failed reason is raised
as the error to the user.

Change-Id: I3a5a7adc97b110fcb8c6e8b156749fdec8924b88

commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator

This includes the following changes:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology
284b13a Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found
9721129 exception: remove
7b0cb37 Don't eat callback exceptions
69abf38 requeue instead of reject

Change-Id: I9113991aebe7d566c8877d74aad9d55b65fdfb9e
Closes-bug: #1178375

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 06:17:38.000000000', 'message': "Don't inject files while resizing instance

Fixes bug 1208680

As what the code owner of method 'finish_migration' in libvirt driver
said, the files injecting operation is not necessary during resize,
because they have already been injected when creating the instance,
so added a parameter to _create_image to fix this issue, which is used
for identifying the injection is needed or not.

Change-Id: I01990de0ad2c7f1c2e499144034b7a4ac9faf024
"}]
commit_message:
Don't inject files while resizing instance

Fixes bug 1208680

As what the code owner of method 'finish_migration' in libvirt driver
said, the files injecting operation is not necessary during resize,
because they have already been injected when creating the instance,
so added a parameter to _create_image to fix this issue, which is used
for identifying the injection is needed or not.

Change-Id: I01990de0ad2c7f1c2e499144034b7a4ac9faf024

commit_message:
Add an exception when doesn't have permissions to operate vm on hyper-v

This commit adds a wrapper checking method when creating/operating
vms on hyper-v, it will raise a HyperVAuthorizationException if the
windows account running nova-compute on this Hyper-V host doesn't
have the required permissions to create/operate the virtual machine.

Fixes bug #1195205

Change-Id: I2ef67a686c99dc83fcc3e9f47a71473929b01e9f

Avishay, cinder supports assertIn for python2.6 at https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/test.py#L304

The value in using assertIn over assertTrue is not only style but also readability and performance. It is much intuitive for the developer when reading test scripts. commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn and assertNotIn

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test if an element is in a sequence
is too python2.4. Our unit testing framework 'testtools' support assertIn and
assertNotIn, included from python 2.7, which were created for these types of
tests. Let's use assertIn or assertNotIn for these tests.

Change-Id: I8b43f7ff5f306e1ce57296d89679333ce24e4b64

commit_message:
Provide default value for service description.

This prevents an exception when service description is missing in markup.

Change-Id: I2f284035fc656a48c1c7525724a34a3b75f72c64
Fixes: bug MRN-920.

commit_message:
Neutron support

Network dropdown added.

To enable support add
"SAVANNA_USE_NEUTRON = True" to local_setting.py

Partially implements blueprint add-neutron-support

Change-Id: I88c795ef6d35caf5fd1780acb3b7dbf1333337af

commit_message:
Generate ssh keys if not present

In a pristine system, there are no ssh keys present, failing to copy
the pub key into the authored_keys file.

Change-Id: I5cc4bfd20ab5c3ed135949ccc153e7c9c23bf8e3

commit_message:
Fix unicode key of azcache can't be stored to memcache

The memcache library we are using assumes all strings passed to
it are plain ascii, so we need to convert unicode to string.

Fix bug #1212164

Change-Id: Ibf36e6b096893cb9f056371bb43cbb441cae6e32

commit_message:
copy_image_to_volume for Nexenta volume driver

This patch implements copy_image_to_volume in Nexenta volume
driver, because volume must be exported before copying image
to it.

Change-Id: I9dc725095944d166fee415f3f605268c7fcbbd3a

commit_message:
Delete expired instance console auth tokens

Instance console auth tokens never get deleted from the cache
before the instnace is deleted, this is a waste of memory. now
we check if tokens are expired then remove them from the cache
before store new tokens.

Fix bug #1209134

Co-authored-by: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I8dd5089ebaed3b3d91932f1f1558bbe302cd5675

[{'created': '2013-08-30 18:53:08.000000000', 'message': "Don't stub LoadBalancer.update in autoscaling tests

Stub handle_update() instead. We can still verify that the arguments are as
expected, while still exercising as much of the logic as possible.

Change-Id: Iebb861bb5af27d92e65083c8bac6821f91382dd5
"}]
commit_message:
Don't stub LoadBalancer.update in autoscaling tests

Stub handle_update() instead. We can still verify that the arguments are as
expected, while still exercising as much of the logic as possible.

Change-Id: Iebb861bb5af27d92e65083c8bac6821f91382dd5

commit_message:
Do updates based on a single dependency list

This ensures that updates proceed in the correct order with maximum
parallelism, for arbitrarily complex dependency graphs.

Change-Id: Ia11f4cfef58a3045199e1e5e49050cb1646f5057

commit_message:
Make security groups associated with Neutron port work

The security group names are now translated to UUIDs which is required
when using the python API. The lookup has been improved to find
existing security groups not part of the stack as well.

Fixes bug #1179481

Change-Id: I4f86bade87f89b867d12822c5f80aa5b075b7fbb

commit_message:
Support ISO8601 duration format for UpdatePolicy PauseTime

Adds a timeutils module in heat common to handle ISO 8601
duration format. Separating this as a different patch per
request.

Change-Id: I2fe6fccde838f4ddac6b898e4518ffb33e2a76fc
Implements: blueprint as-update-policy

commit_message:
Adds API version discovery support for V3

Adds version information for the V3 API which is only displayed
when the V3 API is enabled. Even if the the V3 API is enabled the
V3 API status is "EXPERIMENTAL" and the V2 one "CURRENT". This was
done so autodiscovery tools would not yet use the V3 version by
default.

Ports the relevant parts of the version extension and associated
tests to the V3 API to display V3 version information for /v3 GET
requests.

DocImpact

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Idd335ce0df63d91e94a4a757f1fbae94b576c37e

commit_message:
Make model_base work with sqla 0.7.X

The sqla.inspect module has been introduced in sqla 0.8.X but it could be
replaced with sqla.orm.attributes.instance_state that works ok with both
0.7.X and 0.8.X versions.

Change-Id: Ib78e73f3b94dc7a45f6747dd2fa00f8303144109

subject: Periodic image.exists event generation
messages: [{'account_id': 7163, 'date': '2013-09-02 08:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 7163, 'date': '2013-09-02 08:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-02 08:20:22.000000000', 'message': 'Periodic image.exists event generation

Adds a script which can be run periodically to generate an image.exists
for each image which was active at any point during the past audit
period. Two type of images are considered as having existed during
the given audit period. First are active images that were created
before or during the audit period. Second are images that were
active but were deleted during the audit period. To determine if
and image was or is active, we select based on location having been
set and whether created_at/deleted_at are in range.

Implements blueprint glance-exists-notification
Change-Id: I867ed031e5489b4200f480b6e2f11c76f988e6bb
'}]
commit_message:
Periodic image.exists event generation

Adds a script which can be run periodically to generate an image.exists
for each image which was active at any point during the past audit
period. Two type of images are considered as having existed during
the given audit period. First are active images that were created
before or during the audit period. Second are images that were
active but were deleted during the audit period. To determine if
and image was or is active, we select based on location having been
set and whether created_at/deleted_at are in range.

Implements blueprint glance-exists-notification
Change-Id: I867ed031e5489b4200f480b6e2f11c76f988e6bb

library

commit_message:
Fix V3 API quota_set tests using V3 url and request

V3 tests should using V3 url. Also to make code style consistence, using
V3 HTTPRequest.

part of blueprint v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: Ief1df0bb591941cfaf9555e97bccf21fe1e56594

commit_message:
Correct default ratelimits for v3

* 'change-since' was changed to 'change_since' for v3
* Use the ratelimits middleware that is in v3 limits

fix bug 1216467

Change-Id: I8c466cf2ad8a1f00f002050db01ab68404f607e5

subject: Add alias as prefix to request params for user_data v3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 22:32:14.000000000', 'message': 'emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p
it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to remind user.

Bug #1215404

Change-Id: Ie503fa34e6a3cf7b1f52f0b53019ddea188dabff
'}]
commit_message:
emit warning while running flake8 without virtual env

run_tests.sh -N -p
it will call the flake8 installed on your host to detect PEP8, and
the flake8 plugin "OpenStack hacking" may not installed on your
host, so this command may not detect the OpenStack Style Commandment
supplied by hacking(e.g H202).

run_tests.sh -p
it will call the flake8 from virtual env, flake8 plugin "OpenStack
hacking" installed in virtual env will be triggered.

The result from "run_tests.sh -p" should be trusted, and jenkins uses
virtual env to run flake8 too.

When "-N" is enabled, emit warning to remind user.

Bug #1215404

Change-Id: Ie503fa34e6a3cf7b1f52f0b53019ddea188dabff

commit_message:
Sync rpc fix from oslo-incubator

Sync the following fix from oslo-incubator:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology

This includes one other commit, so that the above fix could be brought
over cleanly:

5ff534d Add config for amqp durable/auto_delete queues

Change-Id: I1fd5aaf87ec87836df3e44e83247bf82301475f5
Closes-bug: #1178375

commit_message:
Disconnect from iSCSI volume sessions after live migration

The live migration source host will now disconnect from
iSCSI volume sessions after the VM is successfully migrated
to the destination host.

Fixes bug 1132146
Change-Id: I132869612bdf2baa810756586e643ea68ea8d8f6

[{'created': '2013-08-21 01:57:27.000000000', 'message': 'Improve H202 to cover more cases

H202 should cover both of following cases:

self.assertRaises(Exception)
self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)

Change to regex to match both cases.

Bug #1214629

Change-Id: I73ac39765b6274f6df9d5251175d9386effae71c
'}]
commit_message:
Improve H202 to cover more cases

H202 should cover both of following cases:

self.assertRaises(Exception)
self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)

Change to regex to match both cases.

Bug #1214629

Change-Id: I73ac39765b6274f6df9d5251175d9386effae71c
