'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-20 23:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't like the eventlet change, a lot.

Swift works fine with the eventlet that ships with precise, why would I need/want to backport another version that to my knowledge no one has ever run a production deployment of swift against?

I'm not sure it doesn't work this way already, but I would greatly prefer it if each project could keep *its* requirement version semantics up-to-date with their own *actual* requirements, which MUST be a satisfiable by the real versions specified in openstack-requirements.

That is to say if openstack-mumbu-jumbo wants to advertise it requires "awesomelib>0.9,<1.0" that's fine as long as openstack-requirements installs and tests with any awesomelib version in that range.  However where projects specify an explicit version it MUST match openstack-requirements.  Which may be exactly what this change is trying to fix - but we should fix it the other way, by opening the swift requirements to allow for tests to run with newer versions of packages that we most likely fully support.

If that's acceptable I could take a stab and getting some sane version specifications in there, and would be greatful to know if there's a automated test that would verify such a change is satisfiable by the versions installed in the gate by openstack-requirements.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-21 13:54:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

At the moment, we do not have the ability to test the version range support in the way you are suggesting. Even if we did, not updating to the new minimums when the rest of OpenStack does can lead you to a sticky situation - which is that the minimums will need to be required by the upcoming versions of Ubuntu and Fedora/RHEL since they can't carry multiple versions. If the swift devs and current deployers don't work on testing changes to the minimums as they occur, then the swift as shipped with Ubuntu/Redhat could actually wind up being broken in some new and exciting manner.

So essentially, the other projects will be pushing that requirement to be the basis of new future installs due to driving distro inclusion.

We've just not gotten to the point where we've got the automation to keep everybody up to date as requirements changes happen. devstack is now upgrading everyones requirements as part of the gate run, and is also gating the requirements repo on that, so at the very least we're testing that the suggested versions functionally work.

Merging this change is not urgent - I suggest we have a conversation when I get back from vacation that also includes sdague - because lack of alignment on requirements ranges has actually caused very real problems over the last cycle."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-08-21 13:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-21 18:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Understood.  Definitely want to find a workable solution.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-08-25 15:45:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

So, taking a step back to make sure I understand everyone's concerns:

Clay: your concern is that this removes some versions that are known to work well, and in fact promotes some versions that aren't production tested (though they are unit tested)

Monty: your concern is that with this version specifier, unit tests don't run for the older versions, and if you install something matching this version specifier, it won't work with other openstack packages?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-02 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-02 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Sync with global requirements

With pbr in the tree, the global requirements syncing code can work
properly - get swift in sync with the current state of the requirements.

Change-Id: I1687d51bddb873549163dcf488fc40cdd9edcb29

commit_message:
baremetal: Log IPMI power on/off timeouts

Added log messages for cloud operators so that they can tell when an
attempt to turn a device on or off via IPMI has failed after the
configured number of attempts.

This should help operators diagnose issues on devices that respond
slowly to IPMI commands.  The failure to repeatedly change the device
power state is now logged precisely along with the cause, where
before operators had to diagnose the issue through trace log captures.

Partial-Bug: #1177584
Change-Id: Iecd6fadb2b653f4ccbe75882c2ef85812b334e8d

commit_message:
Fix network creation in Vlan mode

- If "vlan" is specified when creating a network, we honour the option.
- If it is not specified, the Vlan number is calculated as follows:
CONF.vlan_start + num_existing_networks + index_of_requested_network
- If the above vlan is in use, try to get the next free vlan.

Fixes bug 1194835
Fixes bug 1169026

Change-Id: Id4476c14f9dadcf498a499534337477b3f64f604

[{'created': '2013-08-28 22:37:11.000000000', 'message': 'Merge "Add DocStrings for function allocate_for_instance"

xenapi: Improve test_xenapi unit testing performance.

In investigating performance of the test_xenapi unit testing I
discovered that about 25% of the time is spent in FakeVirtAPI.instance_update.
This function in turn calls db.instance_update_and_get_original to note changes
in state during spawn for most of the unit testing in XenAPIVMTestCase.

XenAPIVMTestCase, doesn't ever check/verify the updating of db based on spawning
of instances.  As such this is wasted effort which can be eliminated since that
verificaiton is not the intent of the tests from what I can gather.

In my testing this reduced running times from 19-20 seconds down to 14-15 seconds
with all unit tests still succeeding.

Fixes bug 1218012

Change-Id: Iaa6441655ad100fdb4ffd2bd5eb6265429c133f6

commit_message:
xenapi: Improve test_xenapi unit testing performance

In investigating performance of the test_xenapi unit testing I
discovered that about 25% of the time is spent in FakeVirtAPI.instance_update.
This function in turn calls db.instance_update_and_get_original to note changes
in state during spawn for most of the unit testing in XenAPIVMTestCase.

XenAPIVMTestCase, doesn't ever check/verify the updating of db based on spawning
of instances.  As such this is wasted effort which can be eliminated since that
verificaiton is not the intent of the tests from what I can gather.

In my testing this reduced running times from 19-20 seconds down to 14-15 seconds
with all unit tests still succeeding. test_xenapi is the by and far the largest
offender in xenapi tests.  Overall xenapi tests we're reduce from
21-22 seconds to 16-17 seconds.

Fixes bug 1218012

Change-Id: Iaa6441655ad100fdb4ffd2bd5eb6265429c133f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-10 07:02:13.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-segment and trunk support for the Cisco Nexus 1000v Plugin.

This will enable the Cisco N1000v switch to integrate with the
Cisco OpenStack Neutron Plugin and be used to drive the
realization of Neutron constructs. Network profiles can be
created of vlan and vxlan trunks to create trunk virtual ethernet
ports. Network profiles can also be created of multi-segment
type and networks can be created to bridge multiple network
segments of different types.

Change-Id: Ibecbbfbce1eb4d18ef6a1bc5250622b9ae87d39c
Implements: blueprint multi-segment-and-trunk-support-cisco-nexus1000v

'}, {'created': '2013-08-23 01:59:24.000000000', 'message': 'Multi-segment and trunk support for the Cisco N1Kv Plugin

This patch adds vlan and vxlan trunk support in the

commit_message:
Multi-segment and trunk support for the Cisco N1Kv Plugin

This patch adds vlan and vxlan trunk support in the
Cisco N1Kv plugin. It also adds support for multi-segment
networks for bridging vlan networks with vxlan networks.

Change-Id: Ibecbbfbce1eb4d18ef6a1bc5250622b9ae87d39c
Implements: blueprint multi-segment-and-trunk-support-cisco-nexus1000v

when trying to debug test failures because it provides you with a
unique identifier in the nova and glance logs for request

'}]
commit_message:
Log request ids from glance and nova

This commit adds an option a log message at the info level to
print the req-id returned from nova and glance. This can be useful
when trying to debug test failures because it provides you with a
unique identifier in the nova and glance logs for request
information. This is done at the info level so that it will be
included in the subunit stream to be printed out during a test
failure to help with debugging.

Fixes bug 1210639

Change-Id: I819f94c538e6a15732dbb4b5c2dafdc270e0b2b4

"}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-07-08 15:26:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Zhongyue Luo: Thanks for you review, you're absolutely right but the patch is currently a work in progress."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-07-08 17:45:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Performance-wise, I'm not sure we want to add JSON blobs into the main instance record which gets loaded and passed around frequently.  These strings would only be needed in the event of a migration."}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2013-07-09 08:35:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Agree with Brian. But before this, 'user_data' was already in instance table. I guest it was not widely used. It may be a issue, too."}, {'account_id': 7238, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:16:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

1. I don't think there should be dependency between /virt and /scheduler.
And by that I mean the use of Scheduler.HostManager in libvirt/driver.py
2. By calling to self.host_manager.get_filtered_hosts(...) You are assuming that the scheduler driver used the filtering host mechanism to select host , which may not be correct.

I do think we should support the scheduler_hints in live_migration but it should be done in the scheduler drivers (not compute drivers)"}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-07-10 09:36:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Brian Elliott & @Tiantian Gao: I don't think that the addition of the JSON blob will significatly change the performance since like Tiantian Gao said 'user_data' is already in instance table... However, i don't see other ways to make scheduler hints persistent during live migration. In my opinion instance table is the good place for that. What do you think about that ?

@Inbar Shapira: Thank you for your review, i think you are right. According to this blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-to-conductor i think the call of get_filterd_hosts() should be done from nova-conductor to nova-scheduler through the rpc api. What do you think about that ?"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-07-10 10:20:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Unfortunately migration number 197 is now taken."}, {'account_id': 7238, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

As I understand this:
1.The compute.check_can_live_migrate_destanation() is  
  called in rpc api from scheduler.driver.live_migartion()
  So I think the call to get_filterd_hosts() should be 
  directly from scheduler.driver.live_migartion()(which is
  the method being called from the nova-conductor in the 
  blueprint you mention) 
2.Although host_manager is part of the scheduler.driver not 
  all driver implementation use get_filterd_hosts(), so I 
  think you should add a new scheduler.driver method 
  "validate_scheduler_hints_for_live_migration" that each 
  driver will implement. (The  filter_scheduler_driver 
  implementation will be calling get_filterd_hosts()), look 
  for example at scheduler.driver.select_hosts()

Please validate this ....'}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-07-12 17:25:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

1. If i look at the conductor i saw that compute.check_can_live_migrate_destination() is 
called from the conductor.tasks.LiveMigrationTask._call_livem_checks_on_host(). 
This method is called from LiveMigrationTask.check_requested_destination() which check the destination host through
several methods before running the live migration. So i think this method is a good place for the validation of the scheduler hints.

2. I think the validation of the scheduler hints should not be done in scheduler.driver implementations since
the conductor can decide to validate scheduler hints if they are present or not into the database before
live migration. In addition, this validation only apply the different filters specified in nova.conf so we can
factorize the code in scheduler.driver directly.

Correct me if i'm wrong, maybe i've missed something... (Sorry for my english)"}, {'account_id': 7238, 'date': '2013-07-14 15:00:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

1. Yes you are correct the live_migration is moving from the scheduler to the conductor tasks so you should call it from the conductor.tasks.LiveMigrationTask._call_livem_checks_on_host()
2. I agree that the conductor can decide to validate scheduler hints before
live migration,  but currently (and I think it should stay like this) the conductor also doesn't know about host_manager only the scheduler.driver knows, so you need to call it from the conductor to the driver using scheduler_rpcapi 

Please validate the dependency between /conductor and /scheduler for the use of HostManager"}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-07-14 15:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7450, 'date': '2013-07-14 15:24:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-14 16:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Check scheduler hints before live migration

This patch permits to check scheduler filters before
live migration, schedulers hints are persisted into
the database in order to be reachable during live
migration process.

Fixes: bug #1198977
Fixes: bug #1039065
Change-Id: I5030029928a0dbfa4f5e60a6caf898bd26fd81d7

'}, {'created': '2013-08-08 10:33:37.000000000', 'message': "VMware: use VM uuid for volume attach and detach

When using the instance name an exception occurs. The problem is due
to the way in which the VM's are named on vCenter. On vCenter the name
of a VM is actually the nova uuid - hence all intercations with the VM
should be done by the uuid. The problem here is that the name was used.

Fixes bug: 1208173

commit_message:
VMware: use VM uuid for volume attach and detach

When using the instance name an exception occurs. The problem is due
to the way in which the VM's are named on vCenter. On vCenter the name
of a VM is actually the nova uuid - hence all intercations with the VM
should be done by the uuid. The problem here is that the name was used.

Fixes bug: 1208173

Change-Id: Iefe1584ee1ded403815cf0ca1fb5206ceadd3e55

commit_message:
Disable retry filter with force_hosts or force_nodes

If customer deploy a VM with force_hosts or force_nodes options,
then there is no need to retry even if retry filter was enabled.

Fix bug 1211597

Change-Id: I2948f48b5c4982cc29899b76889d7d8f0db47449

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-31 00:33:01.000000000', 'message': 'Nicira plugin: always fetch lports from correct lswitch

Bug 1188652

Remove get_logical_port_status which required a lswitch uuid, and
replace it with a call to query_lswitch_ports, which does not
require it.

Change-Id: I6c7d0403f37b2c9fb4332a8d34dcaa9050ced3fc
'}]
commit_message:
Nicira plugin: always fetch lports from correct lswitch

Bug 1188652

Remove get_logical_port_status which required a lswitch uuid, and
replace it with a call to query_lswitch_ports, which does not
require it.

Change-Id: I6c7d0403f37b2c9fb4332a8d34dcaa9050ced3fc

commit_message:
Update openstack.common.config

- Add generator.py from Oslo
- Add notifier from Oslo
- Add generator bash script used by other projects to
generate configuration files
- Update openstack-common.conf file

Work in progress : I have to fix issues when launching
the script for generate the conf file.

Fix bug #1199963

Change-Id: Ic2f457253d4671196dee3323139c39e7031f422b

commit_message:
Refactor BigSwitch error handling to use db rollbacks

This patch adjusts most of the logic handling the
calls to the controller in the BigSwitch/floodlight
plugin to make use of the db rollbacks from
sqlalchemy for free on exceptions. This eliminates
several complex try-except blocks and makes
maintaining db<->controller consistency easier.

Fixes: bug #1215823
Change-Id: Ia636c40e744b3b1c543e891791bf492df4f675d2

commit_message:
Add extra_dhcp_opt extension to BigSwitch/Floodlight plugin

Adds support for the DHCP options extenion to the
BigSwitch/Floodlight plugin.

Fixes: bug #1206655
Change-Id: Ida30ca44ecbb9d1208303e47519427a4111f6025

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-23 16:46:31.000000000', 'message': 'Analyze re-raised exceptions in Cisco Plugin

Checked all cases of re-raised exceptions. In several cases, the exception
was redundant (re-raising the same exception), so the try block and
exception handling was removed.

In one case, exceptions raised from two sources were re-raised with a
a different exception. Instead of doing this, the original exceptions
were changed and the try block and re-raised exception were removed.

In cases where there were database exceptions that were re-raised as
Neutron exceptions, the traceback was left as-is, since it was more
informative to know the higher level source of the issue.

The same was true for the exception mentioned in the bug, where the
original failure was in the ncclient library parsing the configuration
and it would be more descriptive to know that there was a connection
failure or a config failure, that to know the library method.

bug 1213159

Change-Id: Ie334d2548bf651c61e878bf797adaf8c5880eb86
'}, {'created': '2013-08-28 17:19:02.000000000', 'message': 'Analyze re-raised exceptions in Cisco Plugin

Checked all cases of re-raised exceptions. In several cases, the exception
was redundant (re-raising the same exception), so the try block and
exception handling was removed.

In one case, exceptions raised from two sources were re-raised with a
a different exception. Instead of doing this, the original exceptions
were changed and the try block and re-raised exception were removed.

In cases where there were database exceptions that were re-raised as
Neutron exceptions, the traceback was left as-is, since it was more
informative to know the higher level source of the issue.

The same was true for the exception mentioned in the bug, where the
original failure was in the ncclient library parsing the configuration
and it would be more descriptive to know that there was a connection
failure or a config failure, that to know the library method.

bug 1213159

Change-Id: Ie334d2548bf651c61e878bf797adaf8c5880eb86
'}]
commit_message:
Analyze re-raised exceptions in Cisco Plugin

Checked all cases of re-raised exceptions. In several cases, the exception
was redundant (re-raising the same exception), so the try block and
exception handling was removed.

In one case, exceptions raised from two sources were re-raised with a
a different exception. Instead of doing this, the original exceptions
were changed and the try block and re-raised exception were removed.

In cases where there were database exceptions that were re-raised as
Neutron exceptions, the traceback was left as-is, since it was more
informative to know the higher level source of the issue.

The same was true for the exception mentioned in the bug, where the
original failure was in the ncclient library parsing the configuration
and it would be more descriptive to know that there was a connection
failure or a config failure, that to know the library method.

bug 1213159

Change-Id: Ie334d2548bf651c61e878bf797adaf8c5880eb86

Learned flows introduced in commit a369f9e39691c01a4e4f7f8668cb37fc17ba03b3
to learn remote mac addresses on tunnels currently only match local VLAN,
but not destination mac address, as a consequence, connectivity may be

commit_message:
Add missing match in OVS agent tunnel mac leaning

Learned flows introduced in commit a369f9e39691c01a4e4f7f8668cb37fc17ba03b3
to learn remote mac addresses on tunnels currently only match local VLAN,
but not destination mac address, as a consequence, connectivity may be
erratic as soon as more than two agents are used

Change-Id: I467e47d0dd2c1e5aca12a4e240e348116d530d4f
Closes-Bug: #1219074

Change-Id: I7c89140935bd8c9a702deb8ff5bcb892624ff76b
'}, {'created': '2013-08-30 15:00:43.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize timeutils.utcnow_ts()

This patch short-circuits the use of utcnow() when it is not

commit_message:
Optimize timeutils.utcnow_ts()

This patch short-circuits the use of utcnow() when it is not
needed, resulting in a ~7x increase in performance, putting the
cost of the call in the nanosecond range.

Change-Id: I7c89140935bd8c9a702deb8ff5bcb892624ff76b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 20:00:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug to allow for encrypted volume deletion

delete_key in cinder/volume/api.py was called with incorrect parameters.
The error prevented encrypted volumes from being deleted, but the fix
has been applied and unittests written to prove the functionality.

Change-Id: I3b93da84f97efe2a3afa057907bbfa10336eb9de
Implements: blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes bug to allow for encrypted volume deletion

delete_key in cinder/volume/api.py was called with incorrect parameters.
The error prevented encrypted volumes from being deleted, but the fix
has been applied and unittests written to prove the functionality.

Change-Id: I3b93da84f97efe2a3afa057907bbfa10336eb9de
Implements: blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

commit_message:
Remove _create_volume function from several tests

Remove _create_volume function from
- db/test_transfers.py
- api/contrib/test_backups.py
- test_gpfs.py
- test_volume_transfer.py
- test_volume.py
And use create_volume from tests/utils.py instead

Change-Id: I446220d0cfaa2850a5262a968ed35b7827b90a03

commit_message:
Increase test coverage for cinder.image.image_utils

Add new tests for:
	convert_image()
	qemu_img_info()
	fetch_to_raw()
	fetch_verify_image()
	upload_volume()

Change-Id: Ie69af94433b4c61a493d6c38b4c9439a367f7af8

commit_message:
Tenant id filter test is not correct

The test_tenant_id_filter_converts_to_project_id_for_admin is not testing what
it is reporting.
To test that the tenant_id filter is actually mapped correctly to the
project_id filter, the request has to include the all_tenants options too.

That should be make clearer how the tenant_id option actually works.

Change-Id: Id6e8c9d2f39d4dd7ce3bb60400d9cf52c9133f48

commit_message:
Add interface for listing security groups of an instance

This is already available in nova but not exposed via client.

* novaclient/v1_1/servers.py:
   New interface to list security groups of an instance.

* novaclient/v1_1/shell.py:
   New sub command list-secgroup.

* novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py,
  novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_servers.py,
  novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py:
   Add corresponding tests.

Implements: blueprint servers-list-secgroup

Change-Id: I505bcffdbb15b84bfd73cae5ef5a8fb9c69bd7b9

commit_message:
Improve db_sqlalchemy_api test coverage

Added new tests and improved coverage for methods:

 instance_group_*
 migration_*
 task_log_*
 agent_build_*

Blueprint: db-api-tests

Change-Id: Idbf704b3e6aa8df1d4f927e67d108e6a8489b9d2

commit_message:
Add support for Havana missing features in Windows driver

The following features were added:

-copy_volume_to_image (Havana)
-copy_image_to_volume (Havana)
-get_volume_stats (Havana)
-extend_volume (Icehouse)

The test mocking based on binary pickled files were replaced by mox.

Change-Id: I92c681280d6f7b85bcba7a5e3513f2bdb6c13f1d
Implements: blueprint windows-storage-driver-extended

This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2013-08-29 07:58:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hm, the instructions for getting the updated depended commit don't seem to work (checkout parent SHA1, cherry pick depended, cherry pick mine):

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow#Add_dependency

When I cherry pick the depended commit, it's changing the commit hash of the depended commit, so it's won't mapping this review to the dependency. commit_message:
Remove dis/associate actions from security_groups v3

In v3, with the imminent deprecation of nova-network, we're
removing Nova API extension actions that don't add value to
what's already offered by the source API (Neutron).

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I3b75143cd13faab5b1eb6f832876d29636e76fd0

[{'created': '2013-08-02 19:31:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add volume encryption metadata to cinderclient

This modification adds accessors to python-cinderclient for
retrieving volume encryption metadata from Cinder. These changes
provide other services (e.g., Nova) access to encryption
metadata (e.g., encryption key UUIDs). See the volume encryption
key API extension in Cinder for more information.

blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: Id4b2425d699678eb1997863362ddb9bf5ba6f033
'}, {'created': '2013-08-14 14:35:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add volume encryption metadata to cinderclient

This modification adds support for volume type encryption to
python-cinderclient, supporting two Cinder API extensions.

The first support set provides accessors to python-cinderclient for
retrieving volume encryption metadata from Cinder. These changes
provide other services (e.g., Nova) access to encryption
metadata (e.g., encryption key UUIDs). See the volume encryption
key API extension in Cinder for more information.

The second support set creates a new python-cinderclient resource
manager, along with matching shell commands, that provides CRUD
operations for encryption type information. These operations allow
users and services to define encryption information (e.g., cipher,
key size, encryption provider) for a pre-existing volume type. See
the volume type encryption API extension in Cinder for more
information.

blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: Id4b2425d699678eb1997863362ddb9bf5ba6f033
'}, {'created': '2013-08-21 15:57:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add volume encryption metadata to cinderclient

This modification adds support for volume type encryption to
python-cinderclient, supporting two Cinder API extensions.

The first support set provides accessors to python-cinderclient for
retrieving volume encryption metadata from Cinder. These changes
provide other services (e.g., Nova) access to encryption
metadata (e.g., encryption key UUIDs). See the volume encryption
key API extension in Cinder for more information.

The second support set creates a new python-cinderclient resource
manager, along with matching shell commands, that provides creation
and accessor operations for encryption type information. These
operations allow users and services to define encryption information
(e.g., cipher, key size, encryption provider) for a pre-existing

for more information.

blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: Id4b2425d699678eb1997863362ddb9bf5ba6f033
'}]
commit_message:
Add volume encryption metadata to cinderclient

This modification adds support for volume type encryption to
python-cinderclient, supporting two Cinder API extensions.

The first support set provides accessors to python-cinderclient for
retrieving volume encryption metadata from Cinder. These changes
provide other services (e.g., Nova) access to encryption
metadata (e.g., encryption key UUIDs). See the volume encryption
key API extension in Cinder for more information.

The second support set creates a new python-cinderclient resource
manager, along with matching shell commands, that provides creation
and accessor operations for encryption type information. These
operations allow users and services to define encryption information
(e.g., cipher, key size, encryption provider) for a pre-existing
volume type. See the volume type encryption API extension in Cinder
for more information.

blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes

Change-Id: Id4b2425d699678eb1997863362ddb9bf5ba6f033

[{'created': '2013-08-30 18:57:03.000000000', 'message': 'Sync rpc from oslo-incubator

This includes:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology
284b13a Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found
9721129 exception: remove
7b0cb37 Don't eat callback exceptions
69abf38 requeue instead of reject
28395d9 Fixes files with wrong bitmode
bec54ac Fix case error in qpid exchange type "direct"
61c4cde Ensure context type is handled when using to_dict
223f9e1 Clarify precedence of secret_key_file
a035f95 Don't shadow cfg import in securemessage
0f88575 Remove redundant global keyword in securemessage
848c4d5 Some nitpicky securemessage cleanups
5c71c25 Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage
9157286 RPC: Add MessageSecurity implementation
2031e60 Refactors boolean returns
a047a35 Make ZeroMQ based RPC consumer threads more robust
34a6842 On reconnecting a FanoutConsumer, don't grow the topic name
f52446c Add serializer param to RPC service
5ff534d Add config for amqp durable/auto_delete queues

Closes-bug: #1178375
Change-Id: Ib5d4733743041eb2324020f9b1dc553260e79b21
'}]
commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator

This includes:

76972e2 Support a new qpid topology
284b13a Raise timeout in fake RPC if no consumers found
9721129 exception: remove
7b0cb37 Don't eat callback exceptions
69abf38 requeue instead of reject
28395d9 Fixes files with wrong bitmode
bec54ac Fix case error in qpid exchange type "direct"
61c4cde Ensure context type is handled when using to_dict
223f9e1 Clarify precedence of secret_key_file
a035f95 Don't shadow cfg import in securemessage
0f88575 Remove redundant global keyword in securemessage
848c4d5 Some nitpicky securemessage cleanups
5c71c25 Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage
9157286 RPC: Add MessageSecurity implementation
2031e60 Refactors boolean returns
a047a35 Make ZeroMQ based RPC consumer threads more robust
34a6842 On reconnecting a FanoutConsumer, don't grow the topic name
f52446c Add serializer param to RPC service
5ff534d Add config for amqp durable/auto_delete queues
7bfd443 Avoid shadowing Exception 'message' attribute

Closes-bug: #1178375
Change-Id: Ib5d4733743041eb2324020f9b1dc553260e79b21

commit_message:
Introduce InvalidPermission.Duplicate EC2 error code

New SecurityGroupRuleExists exception with 'InvalidPermission.Duplicate'
ec2_code attribute replaced useless EC2APIError.

Note that this error isn't about duplicate group as the code suggests,
but about duplicate permission within a group.

Implements: blueprint ec2-error-codes

Change-Id: I42c94e15a6ca1bc57b10fb683bec17b73de0e0e5

commit_message:
Add block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance to virtapi

Add another conductor api method to the virtapi.  This is needed by the
following patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42812

Part of blueprint qemu-assisted-snapshots

Change-Id: I21d0ebe9f83423d504f7626f0d048b31945156d9

commit_message:
Use ExceptionHelper to bypass @client_exceptions

Rather than stubbing out catch_client_exception() to bypass the wrapping
of exceptions in ClientException, use the existing ExceptionHelper to do
it.

This is important for oslo.messaging, because there's no public API
method for us to stub out.

This is a continuation of I32c83ef15fece35526739c4fcdfccf7a275c7033 as
another stub_out_client_exceptions() usage got merged by
I4120156db1499dfd3ed22095e528787eb73d33a6.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: If4ff9dba58e9f94fab80be804a98c76fff3267b7

commit_message:
compute rpcapi 2.37 is not backwards compatible

Patch 552693e4ad51291c8bfd28cd1939ed3609f6eeac which added compute
rpcapi version 2.37 does not provide any backwards compatibility.

Fix the issue by 'self.can_send_version'.

Fix bug 1217044

Change-Id: I65154fa6298133721b6509b00b117d7f6cc455b8

commit_message:
Fixes missing host in Hyper-V get_volume_connector

Fixes bug: #1215765

The Hyper-V driver is not returning the host in the
"get_volume_connector" method.

This commit fixes the issue by adding the "host" key to the dictionary
returned by the method.

Adds also a unit test for get_volume_connector.

Change-Id: Ic74882e54994f957bf6d2bb75bbd53c6a346042e

The powervm driver is attempting to clean up compressed image gz files
in the migration flow but the rm command being issued doesn't use the
--force option, so the files are piling up on the backing hypervisor.

code (see blockdev.py for example) and fixes the tests so the

commit_message:
powervm: actually remove files after migration

The powervm driver is attempting to clean up compressed image gz files
in the migration flow but the rm command being issued doesn't use the
--force option, so the files are piling up on the backing hypervisor.

This patch properly removes the files like in other parts of the powervm
code (see blockdev.py for example) and fixes the tests so the
_remove_file method is actually tested.

Closes-Bug: #1214985

Change-Id: I82919aa20447230e317c13f51bdf1c204a2eca39

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-01 09:40:53.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: skip metadata updates when VM not found

There is a race condition where change_instance_metdata requests still
get to the compute nodes when the VM has a task in operation that means
the VM is no longer present. This change ensures that we skip the
metadata updates when this occurs.

Currently, if this happens, the long running task, like rebuild or
resize will fail because the VM task_state=None and is put into ERROR.
After this change, it will silently fail, and the updated metadata will
be written when the VM gets re-created as part of the long running
operation.

Fixes bug 1207238

Change-Id: I75e1f93e34d3b3ab93a8e8104fd64224f72d7309

commit_message:
xenapi: skip metadata updates when VM not found

There is a race condition where change_instance_metdata requests still
get to the compute nodes when the VM has a task in operation that means
the VM is no longer present. This change ensures that we skip the
metadata updates when this occurs.

Currently, if this happens, the long running task, like rebuild or
resize will fail because the VM task_state=None and is put into ERROR.
After this change, it will silently fail, and the updated metadata will
be written when the VM gets re-created as part of the long running
operation.

Fixes bug 1207238
Change-Id: I75e1f93e34d3b3ab93a8e8104fd64224f72d7309

Fix one port can be attached to more devices

a port attached to some device should not be attached to another device again

Change-Id: I60de0fa265358ac5b5e1b2c8f370862b32f9e724
Fixes: bug #1204850

commit_message:
Fix wrong method call in baremetal

The `get_pxe_config_file` method is not part of the PXE class.

Change-Id: Ife4f5332af05fd82a865ecdbddf7c5431eb29c1d
Closes-Bug: #1218779

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 18:32:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix warning log message typo in resource_tracker.instance_claim

Just cleans up a small typo in a warning log message that the resource
tracker gives when 'node' is already set on the instance during a claim
operation.

Change-Id: Ic1ece4451f54f4efc8028f8d90de5d240910b20e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix warning log message typo in resource_tracker.instance_claim

Just cleans up a small typo in a warning log message that the resource
tracker gives when 'node' is already set on the instance during a claim
operation.

Change-Id: Ic1ece4451f54f4efc8028f8d90de5d240910b20e

Can you please provide info on how to test this in my seth?  how do i specify the iso etc?  I'd like to give it a whirl and can read the code to figure it out - but any shortcuts appreciated"}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-08-10 11:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

All you need to do is throw in a couple of flags in nova.conf

force_config_drive = true
config_drive_format = iso9660

you should see configdrive.iso on the datastore by the time the vm
starts. and you should be able to mount the iso using mount command in
your vm.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-08-10 18:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Tracy,

1) Check the size of the iso in the datastore ("[Datastore_60G] 7298cc19-aa0e-45ac-94d0-f28f3719ca09/configdrive.iso")

2) It's globally switched on, however the patch generates a single iso for EACH instance that is deployed. The usual information that can be gathered from the nova metadata service is populated on a per instance basis on the iso. This is the same concept as with the other compute drivers (see libvirt/xen/hyperv etc)'}, {'account_id': 7400, 'date': '2013-08-13 00:04:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
VMware: Config Drive Support

Create the config drive iso, upload it to the correct location,
then create a VirtualMachineConfigSpec with appropriate contents
and run the ReconfigVM_Task to enable the iso.

DocImpact

Fixes LP# 1206584
Fixes BP vmware-config-drive-support

Change-Id: I1df1e61edbff9f3a68940d3e3e87fea3be838d11

I have been considering other approaches, but this is probably more apt to this patch.

integer.maxint (and - integer.maxint -1) would have avoided us the double if, but then they're probably not python-3 friendly.
This might even allowed us to use xrange.

But again, I think w *might* take this patch as it is.
Thought?"}, {'account_id': 2711, 'date': '2013-08-30 03:10:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

Will clean up the if tests. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 6659, 'date': '2013-08-30 11:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Salvatore  Yes, I was considering maxint to allow use of xrange or keep a single condition, but had the concern about Python 3, which has removed that constant.

I was thinking None to ignore a limit would be a reasonable approach. Is it worth it to provide a constant, like NOLIMIT=None?

Then, we could say [1, NOLIMIT]. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 6659, 'date': '2013-08-30 11:56:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-30 12:16:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

'}, {'created': '2013-08-29 10:30:40.000000000', 'message': 'Correct VPNaaS limit checks in extension

For the following VPNaaS attributes, ensure that these validation
tests are performed in the extension:

    keepalive >= 60 (seconds)
    mtu >= 0 (octets)
    DPD interval > 0 (seconds)
    DPD timeout > 0 (seconds)

changes in the future (e.g. to allow kilobytes units), then the
test for the value will need to be changed.

To correctly test the MTU limits for an IPSec connection, the
protocol must be taken into consideration, which is defined by
the vpnservice object. Because of this dependency, we cannot
validate this in the extension, and will instead, just make
sure the value is positive.

Likewise, the attribute validators cannot ensure that the
DPD timeout is greater than the interval (again, because the
validators can only check the individual attributes one at
a time).

The range validator was modified to allow single ended ranges
for some of these attributes. The range also ensures the value
is an integer.

Companion changes are being made in the CLI code for these limit
changes.

Update: Fixed typo causing tox failure.

commit_message:
Correct VPNaaS limit checks in extension

For the following VPNaaS attributes, ensure that these validation
tests are performed in the extension:

    keepalive >= 60 (seconds)
    mtu >= 0 (octets)
    DPD interval > 0 (seconds)
    DPD timeout > 0 (seconds)

Currently, the units for keepalive can only be seconds. If this
changes in the future (e.g. to allow kilobytes units), then the
test for the value will need to be changed.

To correctly test the MTU limits for an IPSec connection, the
protocol must be taken into consideration, which is defined by
the vpnservice object. Because of this dependency, we cannot
validate this in the extension, and will instead, just make
sure the value is positive.

Likewise, the attribute validators cannot ensure that the
DPD timeout is greater than the interval (again, because the
validators can only check the individual attributes one at
a time).

The range validator was modified to allow single ended ranges
for some of these attributes. The range also ensures the value
is an integer.

Companion changes are being made in the CLI code for these limit
changes.

Update: Fixed typo causing tox failure.

bug 1216117

Change-Id: I85d6175d81fbe7d27231aed48fb4691351e0db4c

@Dolph, would you please have a review on this patch, as horizon is use case of this patch.'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-08-14 15:43:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Joe,

I have gone through all the threads of '[openstack-dev] [keystone] Pagination' in mail-list. It seems that the topic is mainly on keystone pagination support instead of nova. 

And as said by Jay Pipes, marker/limit is the standard way in all other OpenStack services(Glance/Nova/Cinder) and well documented [1][2][3] 

This patch is a just moving-forward that supports passing marker/limit parameters via novaclient, which would not change the behavior of nova-api. Maybe changing the title to 'Enable passing marker/limit parameters via novaclient' would be more specific for this patch and less misleading.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L429
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L1709
[3] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/common/sqlalchemyutils.py#L33"}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-08-14 16:05:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi Gabriel,

Would you please give some suggestion from perspective of horizon?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-14 17:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Kevin and Joe about adding in explicit kwarg names for limit and marker.

I do NOT think that this should be held up with the discussion on the -dev mailing list, though. The discussion on the -dev mailing list is about the API support for pagination (specifically regarding Keystone). Nova's API already supports pagination filters, and this patch simply wires the client to use those params, if passed.

That said, I don't see where the shell is supplying a limit or filter CLI option that can be fed to the servers.list() function... that needs to be wired up still I think?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-08-14 18:11:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Jay: I don't think it's necessary to wire up the CLI yet; as a patch to the API, this should be sufficient.  A follow-up patch that adds the appropriate options to the CLI would be welcome, though, and it probably wouldn't be that hard to add to this one either"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-14 18:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Fair point, Vek.'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-08-15 13:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-08-15 14:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Suport instance list pagination in novaclient, Part I

Bug 1209242

nova-api has supported pagination for long. A marker and limit
option could be passed to nova-api to get a slice of instances.
It makes sense to enable this feature in novaclient, so that
horizon could use it for pagination supporting. Modification to
shell.py would be submitted in a separate patch.

Further change will also pass 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to
nova-api, as long as nova supports this.

This is part of blueprint support-pagination-for-instance-list

Change-Id: Ieb5f2c1eb31b9f7e95b62b51ea7dc338e3970d04

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-31 02:15:20.000000000', 'message': 'Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc
'}]
commit_message:
Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc

commit_message: Interprete scoped key as nested tags Current codes in xml_util.py does not support REST xml so well when one tagname contains delimiter, it fails to be interpreted. So this patch is to interprete one tagname like "12" as a nested tag like "12". Fix bug:1205983 Change-Id: Ia56ba0da7a840d120298d467d077e6c4eec6f74b

commit_message:
Add OVS isolated network implementation and l3 agent ARP proxy support

This a part of the blueprint isolated-network.

Change-Id: I09a2d2d34f72fd4379d71354db8d1dc093a0a924

commit_message:
Fix missing extend call in base LVM driver

Adds lvmextend call to brick lvm lib and
to the base LVM driver.

Change-Id: I9e542da500ce19c8247a5e4b86115cd8bca15b2c
Fixes: bug 1215672

[{'created': '2013-08-22 00:00:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix 500 error on invalid security-group-rule creation for NVP

Validate that, when creating rules specifying a protocol different
from TCP, UDP, ICMP and ICMPv6, no port (range) is specified because
NVP does not like it.

The extra validation is specific to the NVP plugin because other
plugins may choose a different failure mode. For example, the ovs
plugin does not complain at all, but it just ignores the port range
if the protocol is not a port-oriented one.

Change-Id: I46e9032b5cf7f7d88b9d05c3bf020784b04217d9
'}, {'created': '2013-08-22 00:00:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix 500 error on invalid security-group-rule creation for NVP

Validate that, when creating rules specifying a protocol different
from TCP, UDP, ICMP and ICMPv6, no port (range) is specified because
NVP does not like it.

The extra validation is specific to the NVP plugin because other
plugins may choose a different failure mode. For example, the ovs
plugin does not complain at all, but it just ignores the port range
if the protocol is not a port-oriented one.

Fixes bug #1213293

Change-Id: I46e9032b5cf7f7d88b9d05c3bf020784b04217d9

commit_message:
Fix 500 error on invalid security-group-rule creation for NVP

Validate that, when creating rules specifying a protocol different
from TCP, UDP, ICMP and ICMPv6, no port (range) is specified because
NVP does not like it.

The extra validation is specific to the NVP plugin because other
plugins may choose a different failure mode. For example, the ovs
plugin does not complain at all, but it just ignores the port range
if the protocol is not a port-oriented one.

Fixes bug #1213293

Change-Id: I46e9032b5cf7f7d88b9d05c3bf020784b04217d9

[{'created': '2013-08-31 11:42:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add venv wrapper for check_uptodate.sh

tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh is added in run_tests.sh

For simple, run "run_tests.sh -p" will call it, and get following error:

Failed to collect options from module
cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_common: No module named hp3parclient

Actually, the hp3parclient is listed in test-requirements.txt, and it is
installed in venv.

the check_uptodate.sh should run in venv to get correct result.

update the error message to update the cindier.conf.sample correctly.

-----------
Test method
-----------
$ pwd
/opt/stack/cinder

$ source .venv/bin/activate; tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

(.venv)$ deactivate

$ ./run_tests.sh  -p
Running flake8 ...
// no error emitted here

Fixes Bug #1219197

Change-Id: I9b3eaf3c1a5eb395eefed28bb907685cdef147aa
'}]
commit_message:
Add venv wrapper for check_uptodate.sh

tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh is added in run_tests.sh

For simple, run "run_tests.sh -p" will call it, and get following error:

Failed to collect options from module
cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_common: No module named hp3parclient

Actually, the hp3parclient is listed in test-requirements.txt, and it is
installed in venv.

the check_uptodate.sh should run in venv to get correct result.

update the error message to update the cindier.conf.sample correctly.

-----------
Test method
-----------
$ pwd
/opt/stack/cinder

$ source .venv/bin/activate; tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

(.venv)$ deactivate

$ ./run_tests.sh  -p
Running flake8 ...
// no error emitted here

Fixes Bug #1219197

Change-Id: I9b3eaf3c1a5eb395eefed28bb907685cdef147aa

commit_message:
Handle Centos/RHEL pymongo packages

RHEL/Centos has a different name for pymongo packages.  Fedora doesn't
provide python-sqlite2 so we undef that.

Fixes bug 1194141

Change-Id: If03f420c41e518227a1422882842661dfc8edd7e

commit_message:
Return 400 if creating a distributed router on old NVP platforms

Without checking for the right NVP support, creating a distributed
router will silently fail, i.e. ithe 'distributed' attribute will
be ignored and a centralized router will be created instead.

Supports blueprint nvp-distributed-router

Change-Id: If8e40c0907d78c30f9ba918aaaff57e58ebb8055

Initial feedback from my test.

(2) I cannot remove an existing dhcp option in port-update (http://paste.openstack.org/show/38227/ L.43-65). What I could do is to change existing extra dhcp options specified when port-create.

(3) Even after typo of 'required' in attr map of extension/extra_dhcp_opt.py, the validation logic does not work. When I call "quantum --debug port-create net1 --extra_dhcp_opts list=true type=dict opt_name=bootfile-name", I got the following traceback: http://paste.openstack.org/show/38225/ . If the validation works, the check is done in API layer and _process_port_create_extra_dhcp_opts will not be called.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (2 inline comments)

Let me clarify the specification of extra dhcp option extension. The following are my understanding from reading the code.
Could you check it is same as what you expect? If there is the document, please share the link.

- When port creation:
-- extra dhcp options specified in the REST request are associated with the port created.
-- When a same name is specified in opt_name multiple times, the port creation will fail.
- When port update:
-- Only the dhcp options specified in the update REST request will be updated only if the specified option already exists.
-- dhcp options which are not specified in the request are not changed.
-- There is no way to add new extra dhcp options for the existing port.
-- There is no way to remove some existing extra dhcp options.
- When port deletion
-- extra dhcp options associated with the port are automatically removed.


My concern is the behavior of port-update.

The behavior of extra_dhcp_opts is different from all other list attributes. In all other list attributes, the specified attributes will be overwritten by the passed value. For example, assume security_groups of port 1 has ["sg1", "sg2"], then the new value ["sg3"] are passed, the security_groups of port 1 will be updated to ["sg3"]. The same thing applies to host_routes, dns_nameservers in subnet, routes in extraroute extension. In a case where we want to add/remove an element of list attributes, the common way is to define a subaction for a resource (e.g., add/remove_router_interface in extension/l3.py).

Another concern is there is no way to remove the existing dhcp options. It can be addressed if the first concern is addressed.

Thanks,
Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (2 inline comments)

I wrote an example of the test code. I hope it helps you improve the unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Devananda, thanks for your comment. If replace-all-options does not matter, it is better to use this approach since it is consistent with other neutron API resource model. It is easy to implement too.

I understand this approach is not efficient in a case only one option needs to be updated. It can be done by defining a URL such as /ports/<port-id>/add-extra-dhcp-opts without breaking the existing model.

I wrote a rough API behavior: http://paste.openstack.org/show/39504/

If this direction is ok, the way is easy to go. If needed, I can update the patch.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Could you explain how you addressed the concern I raised at patch set 11 at July 10? Garyk and I shared the same concern.
In addition, could you share the specification or typical usecases you think? What I would like to know is described in my comment on patch 11 (note that it is not inline comments).

I believe it is the most important to clarify the spec before resuming the review. Otherwise we need to understand what you want to implement from the code and it delays the review cycle.'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Akihiro, assuming I understand your comments on rev 10 properly, I will try to answer. I believe in our use case (baremetal, ironic) the list of port options is static. Whether they are updated as update-these-options or replace-these-options won't matter.

That said, I definitely prefer a consistent api over an inconsistent one. In the general case, not being able to add or delete options seems less than helpful to me, fwiw."}, {'account_id': 5572, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
bp: pxeboot-port, provide pxeboot on ports

Teach neutron how to manage PXE boot.

Allow pxe boot parameters to be specified when creating a network port.

Implements bp:pxeboot-ports

Change-Id: I45fe7a16bc6c5975a765dd6a065558b9ba702e5b

[{'created': '2013-08-30 02:18:49.000000000', 'message': 'add require grant allow

Some httpd servers are set up so that the root directory defaults
to denying privileges causing horizon to fail.  This change adds
a command to allow overrides in the horizon directory,

Change-Id: I51da03624582a85bff812acaa21aebdd437d9baa
'}]
commit_message:
add require grant allow

Some httpd servers are set up so that the root directory defaults
to denying privileges causing horizon to fail.  This change adds
a command to allow overrides in the horizon directory,

Change-Id: I51da03624582a85bff812acaa21aebdd437d9baa

[{'created': '2013-08-20 18:51:07.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp storage service feature support.

This change introduces storage service feature for
NetApp drivers. It reports back supported service
features like mirroring, deduplication, compression
etc. to the scheduler which can be used to shortlist
backends. It accepts extra_specs defined
in volume type with the service features and provisions
volumes based on the requested spec.

blueprint cinder-nfs-driver-qos

Change-Id: I0706af2fe39b2db111a6d98b016307fc63f74dc6

commit_message:
NetApp storage service feature support

This change introduces storage service feature for
NetApp drivers. It reports back supported service
features like mirroring, deduplication, compression
etc. to the scheduler which can be used to shortlist
backends. It accepts extra_specs defined
in volume type with the service features and provisions
volumes based on the requested spec.

blueprint cinder-nfs-driver-qos

Change-Id: I0706af2fe39b2db111a6d98b016307fc63f74dc6

[{'created': '2013-08-31 14:01:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove multi_host check for dhcp checksum

This removes the conditional check that actives the workaround
for adding dhcp checksums so that dhcp will work with older clients.
This check is necessary for single host configurations as well as
multi host once as some single code configurations (such as devstack)
will have multiple VM's on one machine with a local dhcp server.

This workaround will save a lot of headache with devstack since without
devstack may mysteriously refuse to work because of dhcp problems.

Change-Id: Iaf03c08b9456a764646eec0efffdb31829502de2
"}]
commit_message:
Remove multi_host check for dhcp checksum

This removes the conditional check that actives the workaround
for adding dhcp checksums so that dhcp will work with older clients.
This check is necessary for single host configurations as well as
multi host once as some single code configurations (such as devstack)
will have multiple VM's on one machine with a local dhcp server.

This workaround will save a lot of headache with devstack since without
devstack may mysteriously refuse to work because of dhcp problems.

Change-Id: Iaf03c08b9456a764646eec0efffdb31829502de2

* Add Database Backups panel.

* Robert Myers (Rackspace)
* Denis Makogon (Mirantis)

[{'created': '2013-08-16 16:32:41.000000000', 'message': 'Correct keyword args in test cases

In tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py, some assertRaises tests do not
pass conf as a keyword argument to self.set_middleware. This patch
correct them and remove test case test_invalid_auth_version_request().
It is because in keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py,
_choose_api_version(), the logic assume that auth_version in conf was
always correct.

Fixes bug #1212984

Change-Id: Idd34dc043526a4eb22b28b144d327fd95aa14af2
'}, {'created': '2013-08-30 12:23:52.000000000', 'message': 'Correct keyword args in test cases

In tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py, some assertRaises tests do not
pass conf as a keyword argument to self.set_middleware. This patch
correct them.

Fixes bug #1212984

Change-Id: Idd34dc043526a4eb22b28b144d327fd95aa14af2
'}]
commit_message:
Correct keyword args in test cases

In tests/test_auth_token_middleware.py, some assertRaises tests do not
pass conf as a keyword argument to self.set_middleware. This patch
correct them.

Fixes bug #1212984

Change-Id: Idd34dc043526a4eb22b28b144d327fd95aa14af2

recheck no bug'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2013-08-22 00:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Couple things to think about.

What happens when you bring a new cell online?

Another way of thinking about this is that flavours are specific to a compute cell. Cells publish their supported flavours upwards to the API level. (they already kind of do with capacity updates)
API cell would then basically only have a cache of available flavours.
This way you could have different flavours at different cells.

When creating a flavour you would specify the cell, you could also have a --all option to just create it on all cells like this patch does.

Something to think about anyway.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-08-22 00:32:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add flavor_create/destroy methods for cell

When creating a flavor in the parent cell it isnt
created in the child cells. At the moment flavors
need to be created individually in all cells.

Fixes bug 1211011

todo:
* Add REST API support to create/destroy flavor for a
  specific cell
* Add related tests

Change-Id: Ia8f497f350af3a2b3da0473ec81f99800fbf13d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 17:40:14.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Create a ghost when deleting an instance

The XenAPI has to scrub the memory used by an instance after deleting
it.  This imposes a delay--variable on the size of the instance and
the speed of the hypervisor host--before that memory can be reused.
To account for the memory being unavailable, this change causes the
virt driver to return a Ghost when an instance is destroyed.  The
expiration time is computed using a simple linear equation, with the
size of the instance memory, in megabytes, being the variable.  The
constants of this equation are set through the configuration options
xenapi_ghost_constant and xenapi_ghost_multiplier, and the expiration
time for the ghost is computed as:

    expire = xenapi_ghost_constant + memory_mb * xenapi_ghost_multiplier

where "memory_mb" is the size of the instance's memory allocation in
megabytes.  The defaults for the configuration options are chosen to
compute one second per gigabyte plus a constant half-second overhead.
As the ghost mechanism is a best-effort mechanism, these defaults
should be sufficient, but they are made configurable for tuning.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I82f5d68f34677869cb76fbf08445acbb6f37e592
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Create a ghost when deleting an instance

The XenAPI has to scrub the memory used by an instance after deleting
it.  This imposes a delay--variable on the size of the instance and
the speed of the hypervisor host--before that memory can be reused.
To account for the memory being unavailable, this change causes the
virt driver to return a Ghost when an instance is destroyed.  The
expiration time is computed using a simple linear equation, with the
size of the instance memory, in megabytes, being the variable.  The
constants of this equation are set through the configuration options
xenapi_ghost_constant and xenapi_ghost_multiplier, and the expiration
time for the ghost is computed as:

    expire = xenapi_ghost_constant + memory_mb * xenapi_ghost_multiplier

where "memory_mb" is the size of the instance's memory allocation in
megabytes.  The defaults for the configuration options are chosen to
compute one second per gigabyte plus a constant half-second overhead.
As the ghost mechanism is a best-effort mechanism, these defaults
should be sufficient, but they are made configurable for tuning.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I82f5d68f34677869cb76fbf08445acbb6f37e592

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-07-31 22:56:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I like this as a general mechanism to discourage immediate re-scheduling to the same compute node.

I'm curious what others think;  I know we talked about this purely in terms of a workaround for XenServer prematurely advertising memory that isn't actually available.

In terms of the implementation, utilizing the driver's destroy method looks good.  It's a little inconsistent that RT cleans up deleted instances differently under the covers of instance update, but I rather like this approach for managing the ghosts better"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-08-03 10:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(6 inline comments)

I have some technical comments.

I think the Ghost could be more intelligent, so it should be able to tell us how many resources does it consume at a given time. Ghost is also prepared to consume different types of expiry information I don't think it is needed. (I just looked at the client in the next change, it is using a float). Also a ghost can report, that he is dead, so we could get rid of it.

GhostSet could be much more simpler, as it only needs to aggregate the reported resources, regardless of time.

Also, the caching in GhostSet is too intrusive. You can see it in the test functions.

Caching should be a separate concern.

Every time you use a comment, consider extracting it to a function."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-11 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 21:43:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add tracking of instance ghosts

With some virt drivers, deletion of an instance does not immediately
release the resources formerly used by that instance; the virt layer
instead must perform some scrubbing for security purposes, which
may take some time.  This change adds the concept of a "ghost" to
nova-compute: a "ghost" is an object which holds the resources
formerly held by the deleted instance until a given expiration time.
A ghost may be returned by the virt driver's destroy() method, in
place of the default None return value.

Ghosts are not persisted to the database; they represent a best-
effort mechanism to prevent scheduling an instance to a host which
may not yet have made the vacated resources available.  Should a
ghost be lost, and a compute node fail to create an instance as a
consequence, the normal rescheduling mechanism should suffice to
ensure the instance is created.

Partially implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I1f9d8e1bfa47a4aab99cfe76567779e841c37a8f
'}, {'created': '2013-07-31 17:40:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add tracking of instance ghosts

instead must perform some scrubbing for security purposes, which
may take some time.  This change adds the concept of a "ghost" to
nova-compute: a "ghost" is an object which holds the resources
formerly held by the deleted instance until a given expiration time.
A ghost may be returned by the virt driver's destroy() method, in
place of the default None return value.

Ghosts are not persisted to the database; they represent a best-
effort mechanism to prevent scheduling an instance to a host which
may not yet have made the vacated resources available.  Should a
ghost be lost, and a compute node fail to create an instance as a
consequence, the normal rescheduling mechanism should suffice to
ensure the instance is created.

Partially implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I1f9d8e1bfa47a4aab99cfe76567779e841c37a8f
'}]
commit_message:
Add tracking of instance ghosts

With some virt drivers, deletion of an instance does not immediately
release the resources formerly used by that instance; the virt layer
instead must perform some scrubbing for security purposes, which
may take some time.  This change adds the concept of a "ghost" to
nova-compute: a "ghost" is an object which holds the resources
formerly held by the deleted instance until a given expiration time.
A ghost may be returned by the virt driver's destroy() method, in
place of the default None return value.

Ghosts are not persisted to the database; they represent a best-
effort mechanism to prevent scheduling an instance to a host which
may not yet have made the vacated resources available.  Should a
ghost be lost, and a compute node fail to create an instance as a
consequence, the normal rescheduling mechanism should suffice to
ensure the instance is created.

Partially implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I1f9d8e1bfa47a4aab99cfe76567779e841c37a8f

commit_message:
Added native ipmi driver

Implemented a power driver for baremetal node that uses the a native
python ipmi driver called pyghmi. Due to the name conflict, ipmi.py
has been changed to ipmitool.py.

Implements: blueprint native-ipmi
Change-Id: I2b9f32876ba01d9d08ba1fc34d5340b14da7c997

'}, {'account_id': 6950, 'date': '2013-08-21 13:13:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Chris: 
Q: I tend to disagree with how all of this is being fixed. Wasn't the problem in the first place that the Windows agent was trying to set hostname on every boot?
A: It was not the windows Agent which was setting the hostname, it was xentools which was reading the xenstore and setting the hostname. 

Q: It shouldn't do that. It should do what the Linux agent does. Ie, It should only set hostname when receiving 'resetnetwork'. 
That would have solved all of this without having to remove 'hostname' from XenStore (which I see that patch has already landed). :(
A: Removing the xenstore message was required otherwise XenTools would overwrite the name set.
Now that we have a new agent feature we can avoid setting the name in xenstore and call a agent feature or as part of resetnetwork we can set the hostname."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-08-23 16:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So the real issue is that the windows agent does nothing, it using assumes an unsupported feature of the Citrix Windows PV tools sets the hostname.
In the rewrite of the tools for 6.1, this feature was, dropped, along with the little CLI tool that the windows agent uses to access xenstore.

So, my preferred solution is to simply set the hostname, on the first boot only, using the "resetnetwork" call. However, on windows that actually requires a reboot, so we should probably try to set the hostname when we run sysprep, or something like that?

Its confusing that we don't update the hostname when you change the name of your server. Although I think that is probably the correct thing to do. However, some users then manually update their hostname. It would seem wrong if we ever then changed it back, particularly because we would probably change it back to the original name, rather that the current name.

Now we may have broken the linux agent... Does it just skip setting the hostname if the hostname is missing from xenstore? We probably want it to do that, and we probably want that in the new windows agent functionality.

Long term, cloud-init will just set the hostname on first boot, using the information in the usual metadata.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-08-23 22:33:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

John:  Hm.

https://github.com/rackerlabs/openstack-guest-agents-unix/blob/master/commands/network.py#L146

We won't fail on reading it.  But we'll pass the default down into the distro-specific code.."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-31 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-31 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Call the set_hostname method on Agent during spawn

Call set_hostname method on Agent if agent supports
this feature. This is required for PV tools 6.1 where
rename feature has been removed.

Fixes: bug #1182934
Change-Id: I8563ecc656f1c5819688f550845f263dd8a93bf9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 19:03:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move comment back to right place

The comment about skipping schedule for create volume from snapshot
in cast_create_volume() was mis-placed when this code was ported to
taskflow.  This patch moves the comment back to where it belongs.

Change-Id: I329c78a05143bf8589d9665dc4ff03fa80da6ec9
'}]
commit_message:
Move comment back to right place

The comment about skipping schedule for create volume from snapshot
in cast_create_volume() was mis-placed when this code was ported to
taskflow.  This patch moves the comment back to where it belongs.

Change-Id: I329c78a05143bf8589d9665dc4ff03fa80da6ec9

commit_message:
Improve support for RHEL derivatives

CentOS, Scientific, SLC, OracleLinux, Amazon, etc. should be treated
just like RedHat.

Change-Id: I8a3ecdf8d0abdd197346bce649bfb51d1158ff79

commit_message:
Use testtools as base test class.

Minor tests refactoring due to use testtools:
 - added missed setUp() and tearDown() to call these functions in
   base test case.
 - removed some superfluous tearDown() calls.
 - moved test_crud_inherited_role_grants_failed_if_disabled() method
   to separate class.

Fixes for python 2.6 enviroment:
 - replaced `with self.assertRaises(Exception): foo()` to
   `self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)
 - added to safe_repr(), assertDictEqual() and assertRaisesRegexp() methods
   to TestCase() class in keystone/test.py

Fixes bug 1179009

Change-Id: Iea67ad10d02db82fc8ed79b1096ddb5233925bfd

subject: Clarify sql string when not using nova-conductor

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 16:13:18.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify sql string when not using nova-conductor

You do not have to use nova-conductor and can
instead use direct DB connections from the compute
nodes. This change makes a note and clarifies the
nova.conf changes which are required if you wish to
do so.

Change-Id: I60baf1b235172ef4ea8152b0119543d17e07cd42
'}, {'created': '2013-08-30 20:08:54.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify sql string when not using nova-conductor

commit_message:
Clarify sql string when not using nova-conductor

You do not have to use nova-conductor and can
instead use direct DB connections from the compute
nodes. This change makes a note and clarifies the
nova.conf changes which are required if you wish to
do so.

Change-Id: I60baf1b235172ef4ea8152b0119543d17e07cd42

This is good start Santhoshkumar. I do have quite a few comments in the code, please take a look. 

Several high level questions:
1. It seems name lookup service only deal with initiator that has been logged
in to fabric. (get_device_mapping_from_network). For NPIV this won't be the case. Design has described the look up based on the physical port WWN(page 8). Is this covered or I just missed it?

2. When there are multiple add_connection/delete_connection requests come in concurrently, there seems no locking around that. Could this cause problem on the same switch that generates multiple cfg save cfg enable
at the same time? What happens if the cfg are conflict each other. On the other side, if there are concurrent request could we combine the request into one cfg save and enable it in stead of multiple one?"}, {'account_id': 6043, 'date': '2013-08-15 15:33:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add support for FC zone lifecycle management

Allows automated zone lifecycle management in the attach/detach
entry points of the volume manager for FC volumes (when fabric
zoning is enabled). Zones are configured automatically as part
of the active zone set in the FC SAN to provide a more flexible
and secure way of controlling access. FC zone manager enables
SAN vendors to add support for pluggable implementations.

TODO: Base PWWN lookup support, common code refactoring, SSH
connection pool review comments, exception/error handling
review comments

Change-Id: I0a9ef5b8e785c53fe4b35cf997f45feb89840c8c
Implements: blueprint cinder-fc-zone-manager

Hello, Dolph Mathews. Please refer to bug #1212984 and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42380/. This test case could pass due to the incorrect assertRaises (do not pass conf as a keyword argument to self.set_middleware). In keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py, _choose_api_version(), the codes's logic assume that auth_version in conf is always correct, so the testcase test_invalid_auth_version_request() is incorrect. Brant Knudson suggest me split this up into separate changes, one to fix the conf keyword parameter and the other to remove the test_invalid_auth_version_request() testcase. So I create a new bug to remove this testcase."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-08-30 15:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Change-Id: I6aec0526a6a60eea8d357ec1b44570e7d74da653
"}]
commit_message:
Remove testcase test_invalid_auth_version_request

In keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py, _choose_api_version(), the
codes's logic assume that auth_version in conf is always correct, so the
testcase test_invalid_auth_version_request() is incorrect. This patch
remove it.

Fixes bug #1218881

Change-Id: I6aec0526a6a60eea8d357ec1b44570e7d74da653

I with I could do smarter comments like Peter's but I like where this is going as-is, and I cannot get past the small stuff in my inline comments"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-30 23:45:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (8 inline comments)

Hey guys, thanks for the comments - I'll need you to please review my responses and elaborate on what you feel needs to change.  I'm mostly going to be working on the weird EOFError that I can't seem to duplicate on my machine.

Last note on motivation, this is a big change, so I was going for a short diff not an optimal solution.  Most of my choices where based on readability of the diff and not readability of the code because all this code is going to change again in the next iteration, and the next after that, and after that...

But every direction I go towards a better world involves dropping keep_data_fp.  Particularly adding an explicit open method seemed to be the shortest path to get there, the context manager just sorta fell out.

There may be ways to make this patch even smaller, and maybe that would be a good idea?  What do you think about leaving all the is_deleted, is_expired checks in the object-server for one more round?  Or Pete had the idea of pulling the metadata off the disk file with a method and updating the object-server to reference a local copy instead of an attribute on the disk_file instance?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-08-31 00:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-31 00:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Remove keep_data_fp argument from DiskFile constructor

All access to the data_file fp for DiskFile is moved under the new "open"
method.  This reduces the surface area of the DiskFile abstraction and reduces
the exposure of the underlying implementation in the object-server.

Future work:

 * Add public "create" method to DiskFile to wrap DiskWriter
 * Add public "delete" method to DiskFile
 * Consolidate put_metadata to DiskWriter
 * Add public "update_metdata" method to DiskFile
 * Move all access of .metadata property in object-server under "open"
 * Create DiskReader class to gather all access of methods under "open"

Change-Id: I932ab3669e4cd1a48555cdadbeb984ba6c8efb1a

commit_message:
Make obj-auditor audit to data w/ multiple store policies

object will be stored in directories like 'objects', 'objects-1',
'objects-2'..., so simply update obj-auditor to audit these data
also.

Change-Id: I76dbc6c33a0c9093df4bf7cf00b0f2747ebd978d

commit_message:
Create RPC connection before modifying OVS bridges

On startup, the agent removes and readds flows to the OVS bridges.  If
an RPC setup error exits the process prematurely, this can leave the
bridges in an unsafe state.  It is better to set the RPC communication
up before making changes to the host system.

Closes-Bug: 1217980
Change-Id: Ib9bbb864b9129bb7b1376a150a37a0c07908d74b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>
